b'Rep. Ted Budd (R-NC) told\xa0Breitbart News Tonight\xa0that House swing district Democrats have \x93squandered\x94 the opportunity to pass a bipartisan infrastructure project.
Breitbart News Tonight\xa0host Rebecca Mansour and Breitbart News reporter John Binder spoke to Rep. Budd about the importance of passing an infrastructure bill that could revitalize America\x92s highways, roads, and bridges.



Mansour noted that while swing district Democrats managed to pass the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) through the House, they still have to fulfill many of their 2018 campaign promises.
Thirty swing district Democrats managed to flip Republican districts during the 2018 midterm elections and take the House majority by promising to enact healthcare legislation, protect patients with preexisting conditions, and pass bipartisan legislation such as infrastructure.

President Donald Trump, Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-NY), and House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) had preliminary negotiations on an infrastructure bill in 2019; however, the president said that Pelosi \x93blew up\x94 any chance of an infrastructure deal by investigating the president and moving towards impeachment.
Mansour noted that Rep. Budd\x92s legislation, the Generating American Income and Infrastructure Act (GAIIN) Act garnered significant bipartisan support. The GAIIN Act would require the Department of Agriculture to sell its distressed assets and use the proceeds to develop infrastructure in communities below the poverty line. The GAIN Act would also use half of its profits to help pay down the national deficit.
Reps. Mike Kelly (R-PA) and William Lacy Clay (D-MO) backed the legislation. Members of both the Freedom Caucus and the Congressional Black Caucus (CBC) also endorsed the legislation.
House Republican Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-CA) also backed the GAIIN Act as part of a larger infrastructure bill.
The\xa0Breitbart News Tonight\xa0host asked the North Carolina congressman if he believes that there remains a compromise on infrastructure to occur. The North Carolina conservative said that although there remains an opportunity for a compromise, he does not see anything more than \x93empty talk\x94 coming from swing district Democrats on infrastructure.

Rep. Budd told\xa0Breitbart News Tonight that the GAIIN Act \x93is\xa0a great bill, it still is. We\x92re actually trying to reach across the aisle and get them to support it again, but because you\x92re talking about infrastructure and their lack of an appetite for it this time, I think they\x92re hardening into partisan positions \x85 This was a bipartisan bill; it took $50 billion of non-performing assets or bad debts and sold them off into the public market at and used $25 billion of that to reduce the deficit and $25 billion to go to distressed communities around our country and do infrastructure there and hire from within those communities.\x94
\x93It was a great bill supported by the Congressional Black Caucus and the Freedom Caucus, both sides of the political spectrum. It\x92s a smart bill, and it had a lot of support from a lot of folks, but \x85 across the aisle, they don\x92t have any interest this year and that shows that infrastructure tends to be bipartisan, and I don\x92t see that happening in the next ten months,\x94 Rep. Budd added.
\x93I wish it did, but I don\x92t see it. Now we could always be surprised \x97 this is an industry of surprise of here in politics,\x94 the North Carolina congressman added.
As recent polls have revealed that voters in swing districts have increasingly soured on freshman Democrats that back impeachment, those battleground Democrats will move into the 2020 election cycle with little to no victories in Congress other than impeachment.
However, as Rep. Budd said, Democrats have \x93squandered the opportunity\x94 to pass an infrastructure bill that could revitalize America\x92s highways, bridges, and airports.

b'The foreign-born share of the U.S. workforce is slightly declining as President Donald Trump\x92s \x93Hire American\x94 economy pulls millions of sidelined Americans into jobs.
This gain for all American employees was revealed in the January 10 jobs report\xa0that showed the number of employed Americans rose in the last twelve months, while the number of foreign-born people in jobs declined during the same period.


The number of Americans earning wages rose by 1.23 million, up to 135.9 million, during the last twelve months, said the Bureau of Labor Statistics.
The number of foreign-born workers \x97 legal immigrants, illegals, and visa workers \x97 in U.S. jobs fell from 27.4 million to 27.2 million. That is\xa0a drop of 170,000\xa0during the same period.
The data may be modestly skewed by incomplete counts, but the trend is that Americans are gaining a larger share of jobs amid the continued inflow of migrants, said\xa0Steven Camarota, the research director at\xa0the Center for Immigration Studies. He said:

There does seem to be some evidence that Americans are making significant gains [even] as the level of immigration \x85 has not accelerated. It looks like maybe Trump\x92s policies of reducing refugees, cracking down on illegal migration, and increased vetting of green cards [for new legal migrants], \x85. may have resulted in native[-born Americans] making gains \x97 that is a reasonable interpretation of data.
Routine deaths and departures can partly explain the migrant reduction, he said. But the data also seems to undercount the flow of migrants who came through the Mexican border in 2019, he added.
Yet the data marks a change from the pro-migrant policies pushed by President Barack Obama.
In the six Obama years from December 2010 to December 2016, 3.73 million foreigners got jobs, even as Americans gained 8.91 million jobs as the country slowly pulled out of the depths of the Great Recession.
In the two Trump years from December 2017 to December 2019, migrants gained 1.13 million jobs, while Americans gained 3.77 million jobs.
Under Obama, five Americans got jobs for every two jobs gained by legal or illegal migrants.

Under Trump, seven Americans got jobs for every two jobs gained by legal or illegal migrants.
The data shows a win for the America-first policies got Trump elected in 2016.

The numbers are also a win for Ivanka Trump\x92s campaign to make U.S. companies train more Americans for many jobs that companies would prefer to fill with cheaper migrants. On January 7, she told an industry convention:
When I hear employers [who] would come to me and they\x92d say, \x91We need more skilled workers, we need more skilled workers,\x92 and then I\x92d read about them laying off segments of their [American] workforce because they were investing in productivity, and not having spent the time \x97 when they had known three years prior they\x92d be making that investment and upgrading those systems \x97 not taking the time to take those workers and reskill and then retrain them into their job vacancies, well, I have very little sympathy for that.
In contrast, many Democrats want the federal government to help more illegals and more legal migrants get into the U.S. workforce \x96 despite the damage to Americans\x92 wages, housing prices, and K-12 schools:

Democrat AGs oppose Trump's plan to protect wages for blue-collar Americans by denying fast-track work permits to illegals & migrants: "That's bad for immigrants .. Give me your tired, your poor \x85 harm businesses \x85 [who must] find replacement labor."https://t.co/BgMv2OHgsy
\x97 Neil Munro (@NeilMunroDC) January 15, 2020'

b'Hundreds of members of a new migrant caravan pushed their way past Honduran border police and into Guatemala Wednesday. The group claims to be heading to the United States.
\x93There is no work here, the government has abandoned us,\x94 26-year-old Honduran Antony Gomez said in an AFP article published by Yahoo News. Other migrants also expressed desire for work, making their quest that of economic migration.


Approximately 400 men, women, and young children made their way to the northern Honduran town of San Pedro Sula on Tuesday, the news agency reported. By Wednesday, the group refused to register with migration services in Honduras and began pushing their way past a line of police to cross into Guatemala \x97 the first step on a journey that would take them into Mexico and on to the United States.
AFP reports police allowed some adults through but kept families with small children from crossing.
This is not the first journey for some, The\xa0Washington Post reported Wednesday night.

Honduran 18-year-old Walter\xa0Mart\xednez told the reporter he made the journey into the United States where he lived with his family in Houston until being deported in November. The newspaper did not say why the Honduran teen was removed.
The Associated Press reported seeing about 20 Honduran migrants being driven back to the border after they failed to register with Guatemalan immigration officials.
The\xa0Post reported that the Department of Homeland Security deployed dozens of U.S. federal agents and investigators to Guatemala to provide advice to the national police and immigration officials. The move was part of a security agreement negotiated under the Trump Administration\x92s efforts to curb mass migration to the U.S. that peaked in May 2019.
This week, Honduras\x92 top law enforcement official Julian Pacheco claimed the caravans were being funded and manipulated by \x93perverse\x94 parties and promised to unmask them in the coming days. Pacheco\x92s statements about the new caravan sound similar to a revelation made by Mexico\x92s government in June 2019 when it announced they froze 26 accounts linked to groups tied to previous caravans.
Mexico is also being pressured to stop the flow of Central American migrants to the U.S. border.

Breitbart Texas reached out to DHS and CBP officials for a reaction to the developments. An immediate response was not available.
During Fiscal Year 2019, which ended on September 30, 2019, Border Patrol agents apprehended more than 14,000 Honduran migrants who illegally crossed the border from Mexico, according to CBP reports. Those included 1,587 unaccompanied minors, 6,218 migrant families, and 6,234 single adults.
They were joined in crossing the border illegally by more than 18,000 Guatemalans, nearly 6,400 Salvadorans, and more than 47,000 Mexicans. More than 40,000 of the Mexican migrants were reported as single adults.

b'Islamic extremism is a primary driver of Christian persecution in eight out of the ten most dangerous places for Christians to live, Open Doors revealed Wednesday in its World Watch List 2020.
In Somalia, for instance, number three on the list of the 50 countries where Christians face the most serious persecution, the violent Islamist group, al-Shabaab \x93has repeatedly expressed its desire to eradicate Christians from the country,\x94 Open Doors noted.


Some 99 percent of Somali citizens are Muslims, and being exposed as a convert to Christianity results in life-threatening peril, \x93often leading to on-the-spot execution,\x94 the report observed. \x93As a result, most Somali Christians keep their faith completely secret.\x94
The situation has only gotten worse over recent years, the report stated, and Christians in Somalia are so vulnerable to attacks by Islamic militants that \x93in the interests of security,\x94 Open Doors decided not to publish specific examples of persecution for fear of inciting further violence.
In Libya, on the other hand, various Islamic militant groups have gained control over parts of the country and \x93Libyan converts to Christianity face abuse and violence for their decision to follow Christ,\x94 Open Doors said.

\x93Christians are at risk all over the country, but especially vulnerable in areas where radical Islamic groups are present,\x94 the report states. \x93ISIS still maintains a presence in the wider region around Sirte. Other groups, like those connected to the Islamic Dawn coalition control areas around Tripoli and some parts of Tripoli itself. In the East, radical groups are at least present in Benghazi.\x94
In the fifth worst country for Christians, the Islamic Republic of Pakistan, Christians live under the constant threat of mob attacks, Open Doors revealed.
As a tiny minority of the heavily Muslim population, all Christians \x93suffer from institutionalized discrimination, illustrated by the fact that occupations seen as low, dirty and derogatory are reserved for religious minorities like Christians by the authorities,\x94 the report said.
Even the few Christians belonging to the middle class are not exempted \x93from being marginalized or persecuted in an Islamic culture,\x94 the report said, and \x93believers are always at risk because of the country\x92s notorious blasphemy laws.\x94
Christian women often suffer most, being \x93targeted for both their faith and their gender,\x94 Open Doors said. \x93An estimated 700 girls and women abducted each year are raped and then forcefully married to Muslim men in the community, usually resulting in forced conversions.\x94
The only two exceptions to the Islam-driven persecution of Christians among the ten worst nations are North Korea, where a virulently atheistic communist ideology reigns, and India, where another form of religious extremism \x97 Hindu nationalism \x97 drives most of the anti-Christian hostility.
A possible third exception to the rule is the case of the African nation of Eritrea, whose population is roughly split between Muslims and Christians. Although many Christians, especially converts from Islam, face abuse and persecution from their families and communities, much persecution also originates from the government, which maintains strict control over religious activities.

b'President Donald Trump announced his administration\x92s effort to defend prayer in school on Thursday, as part of recognizing Religious Freedom Day.
Trump said:


It is a sacred principle of our Republic, that government must never stand between the people and God, yet in public schools, authorities are stopping students and teachers from praying, sharing their faith or following their religious beliefs. It is totally unacceptable.
The president criticized a \x93growing totalitarian impulse on the far left\x94 that tried to wipe out religious expression in the public square, something that would never have happened in America in the past.
\x93The right of students and teachers to freely exercise their faith will always be protected, including the right to pray,\x94 he said.
Nine agencies in the Trump administration released proposed rules to ensure that religious organizations would not face discrimination because of their beliefs.

The Trump administration also updated federal guidance to protect prayer and religious expression in public schools.
Secretary of Education Betsy Devos thanked Trump for defending the right to religious freedom, detailing the new proposed rule to defend religious liberty:
Too many misinterpret a separation of Church and state as an invitation for government to separate people from their faith. In reality, our Constitution doesn\x92t exist to protect us from religion, it exists to protect religion from government.
Trump was joined by several school prayer activists and teachers and students who faced criticism for praying in school.
Devos also said that new guidelines issued by the Department of Education would require states to establish a clear process protecting the right for teachers and students to prayer in school.
One girl, Hannah Allen from Texas, said she and some friends were praying for a sibling of a fellow student who was injured and was told by a principal afterward to stop praying publicly in school.

\x93I know that if this can happen in a small town in Texas, it can happen anywhere, across America,\x94 she said. \x93And that\x92s not right. No one should feel ashamed of their faith, especially in school or anywhere.\x94
One small boy, William McLeod from Utah,\xa0spoke about how he went to class on Ash Wednesday with ashes on his forehead and was forced by the teacher to remove the ashes in front of class.

\x93That\x92s a beautiful story, well told,\x94 Trump said, shaking the boy\x92s hand. \x93It\x92s not going to happen anymore.\x94
A Muslim girl from California,\xa0Malak Hijaz, said she was harassed by fellow students for praying five times a day and covering her head and said the principal blamed her for the disturbance.
A Jewish girl from Florida spoke about how her open practice of her faith led other students to bully her. She teared up as she recalled students writing swastikas on her arms and belongings.

\x93I was terrified to say I was Jewish, and that should be in anyone\x92s mind,\x94 she said.
Emily Chaney, a girl from Kentucky, spoke to the president about how her school \x93prayer locker\x94 that allowed students to post prayer requests publicly was attacked by the Americans United for the Separation of Church and State.
\x93I was heartbroke,\x94 she said, noting that she had at least ten prayer requests a day.
\x93I\x92m just so thankful for you, and all you\x92ve done,\x94 she said. \x93Thank you.\x94
Trump acknowledged to reporters that there was a \x93cultural war\x94 in the United States and that he would continue to defend the public expression of religion while he was president.
The president said that government officials were taking the word \x93God\x94 out of public places just like they were taking the word \x93Christmas\x94 out of society.
\x93We\x92re not going to let it happen, we\x92re never going to let that happen, and we\x92re fighting it very hard,\x94 Trump said.'

b'Kyle Jurek, a field organizer for Sen. Bernie Sanders\x92 (I-VT) presidential campaign, was arrested just days before Project Veritas released undercover footage of the\xa0self-described \x93anarcho-communist\x94 suggesting that Trump supporters require re-education in Soviet-style concentration camps.
Jurek was arrested on\xa0January 8 by Iowa state police, according to\xa0Polk County, Iowa, Sheriff\x92s Department. Jurek was charged with violation of probation, possession of drug paraphernalia,\xa0failure to provide proof of financial liability, as well as\xa0operating while intoxicated \x97 his second offense. The 38-year-old was previously arrested in September 2019 for possession of a controlled substance, unlawful possession of a prescription drug, and possession of drug paraphernalia.


Jurek is at the center of Project Veritas\x92s latest sting targeting 2020 Democrat candidates.
He was filmed arguing that gulags were beneficial for the\xa0Soviet Union and suggesting they\xa0could be used to re-educate both Trump voters and billionaires.
\x93In Nazi Germany, after the fall of the Nazi Party, there was a shit-ton of the populace that was fucking Nazified,\x94 says Jurek. \x93Germany had to spend billions of dollars re-educating their fucking people to not be Nazis,\x94\xa0Jurek is seen explaining to an undercover Project Veritas staff member. \x93We\x92re probably going to have to do the same fucking thing here. That\x92s kind of what all Bernie\x92s whole fucking like, \x91hey, free education for everybody\x92 because we\x92re going to have to teach you to not be a fucking Nazi.\x94

\x93[The] greatest way to break a fucking billionaire of their privilege and their idea that they\x92re superior, go and break rocks for 12 hours a day. You\x92re now a working class person, and you\x92re going to fucking learn what the means, right?\x94 he adds.
In another part of the video, Jurek warns that Milwaukee, host of this year\x92s Democratic National Convention, will \x93burn,\x94 and police will be \x93beaten\x94 if the Vermont senator loses the nomination.
\x93If Bernie doesn\x92t get the nomination or it goes to a second round at the DNC convention, fucking\xa0Milwaukee will burn,\x94 Jurek is seen saying. \x93It\x92ll start in\xa0Milwaukee and then when the police push back on that, other cites will fucking [explode].\x94
\x93We\x92re going to make [1968] look like a fucking girl\x92s scout fucking cookout,\x94 he then warns, referring to the\xa01968 DNC convention\xa0in Chicago, where\xa0left-wing activists\xa0engaged in violent riots in the streets. \x93The cops are going to be the ones fucking beaten in\xa0Milwaukee.\x94
Despite Jurek\x92s statements, he still appears to have employed by the Sanders campaign, which has yet to address Project Veritas\x92s explosive footage.'

b'Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) engaged in \x93collusion\x94 with CNN in \x93one of the most egregious calculated hit jobs that we\x92ve ever really seen in modern political history,\x94 independent journalist\xa0Michael Tracey told Breitbart News, referring to allegations made by Warren \x97 and leaked to CNN\xa0\x97 that Sen. Bernie Sanders (D-VT) privately told her a woman could not win the 2020 presidential election.
Tracey joined Wednesday\x92s edition of SiriusXM\x92s Breitbart News Tonight with host Rebecca Mansour and special guest host John Binder.


\x93CNN totally accepted the framing of Warren\x92s side of this quote-unquote argument being correct,\x94 said Tracey, describing the CNN moderator\x92s question for Sanders concerning the allegation at Tuesday\x92s Democrat debate in Des Moines, IA. \x93It was choreographed by the Warren campaign with an assist from CNN. They leaked this story \x97 attributed to sources \x97 to CNN the day before CNN was hosting the debate, and they knew it was obviously going to be asked at the debate, and Warren had pre-prepared talking points at the ready, so what you really have to describe this as, I think, is collusion \x97 remember that word? \x97 between the Warren campaign and CNN.\x94
LISTEN:


Afterwards, Sanders\x92 supporters described the CNN-hosted debate as \x93rigged,\x94 sharing hashtag messages #IStandWithBernie and #CNNIsTrash.
Tracey explained, \x93[Elizabeth Warren]\xa0 actually is working alongside a corporate media outlet to take down the leading candidate of the left, and it\x92s ironic, because Warren was widely touted as Bernie\x92s most loyal ally, and they had this so-called pact, which, of course, was never going to hold, because as Warren\x92s campaign gained a measure of momentum over the past year, she brought on many Hillary Clinton-style retreads \x97 people within the Democratic Party\x92s sort of institutional apparatus who you just knew deep down were never going to be content with Bernie. And they brought on a whole set of people who, I guess, have successfully lobbied for Warren to depict herself now, in this sort of last ditch effort to regain the lead, as the champion of women.\x94
Warren seeks to use her sex as a political commodity, added Tracey, \x93[Elizabeth Warren] telegraphed, weeks ago, that she was now going to be presenting herself as the first woman candidate, and to use that as a central argument for why she was the most desirable candidate to be nominated.\x94
\x93[This] looks like a total ambush,\x94 said Tracey of CNN\x92s Wednesday release of audio capturing a post-debate exchange between Sanders and Warren.\xa0
Mansour asked if Warren knew her post-debate exchange with Sanders would be captured and publicly shared by CNN.

\x93Of course she did,\x94 replied Tracey. \x93The entire thing was orchestrated. That\x92s what\x92s so craven about it.\x94
He also noted that some media figures are using the language of the #MeToo movement in discussing the Sanders-Warren disagreement.

\x93It\x92s not just random trolls on the Internet trying to appropriate the #MeToo nomenclature in reference to this episode,\x94 observed Tracey. \x93It\x92s high-profile journalists with a lot of influence like Julia Ioffe, who is widely touted as a leading expert \x97 mostly on Trump-Russia stuff, where she\x92s totally failed, so it\x92s not surprising to me that she would fail in her analysis of this situation.\x94
Tracey continued, \x93Just think of how despicable that is. Whatever you think of #MeToo, the whole concept that you need to believe women or at least give women more of a benefit of the doubt was intended to apply specifically to situations where there was ambiguity around claims of sexual assault. And they\x92re now transposing that onto a dispute between two politicians, one of which happens to be a man and one of which happens to be a woman. So it\x92s a total manipulative distortion of that entire concept.\x94
Warren\x92s coordination with CNN may damage her credibility among those on the left, speculated Tracey.

\x93It\x92s ironic, because if you had said a year ago that Elizabeth Warren would end up employing tactics that actually exceed anything Hillary [Clinton] ever dared to try in 2016 in terms of sleaziness, I think I would\x92ve gotten a lot of people who would say, \x91No, there\x92s no way that would ever happen.\x92\x94 Tracey said. \x93But this is, I think, qualitatively worse than anything Hillary tried to pull off, because, number one, Hillary didn\x92t perceive Bernie as as much of a threat in 2016 as Bernie is now, because he\x92s leading in some of the polls, he\x92s definitely in contention to win the first few contests, and Hillary \x97\xa0 I\x92m not giving her, necessarily, credit for this \x97 but when she did attack Bernie it was at least about issues, like she accused him of being complicit in the Sandy Hook shooting because of gun control stances he had had in the past, etc., so that was definitely sleazy, but this was just an act of blatant political betrayal, because it entails Warren confiding what had previously been a private conversation \x97 that [was] held in confidence \x97 and then weaponizing that to put the worst possible spin on it in service of orchestrating this last ditch smear attempt, which has now gone on a couple of days.\x94
\x93I don\x92t know how effective it will be,\x94 Tracey continued. \x93I\x92m obviously not the target audience of it because I find it to be incredibly cynical and cheap, but I think there are still some people in the Democratic primary electorate who have lingering resentment toward Bernie because of their perception, I think falsely, that he harmed Hillary egregious in 2016, and so if Warren now is presenting herself as the last stand for female power in the party or something, then maybe it could actually work to her benefit. I don\x92t know. I think it may end up damaging them both, which again, I think, is incredibly ironic, because I personally have been told that Warren is the greatest ally that Bernie could ever want, and I also get people telling me that Tulsi Gabbard is like the evil imposter who is just trying to cause chaos in the Democratic Party. But it turns out that Warren is a much greater offender, and actually, Tulsi Gabbard came to Bernie\x92s defense after this really spilled out into the public on Monday, just like she did in 2016 when she resigned from the DNC to endorse him. So I feel like people who have had a certain conception of the role Warren\x92s playing in the context of this primary have some egg on their faces.\x94
Binder asked why Warren would hold such a claim to herself since 2018, when she alleges Sanders made the aforementioned remark about a woman\x92s inability to be elected to the White House.
Tracey responded, \x93That tells you, again, how blatantly calculated this was, right? Because she sat on the information for over a year and timed it for a couple of days after Bernie got a couple of good polls, one showing him in the lead in Iowa.\x94
Tracey speculated about how this incident will be received by Democratic primary voters. 
\x93I think there\x92s a certain species of primary voter who would feel that their negative perceptions of Bernie are being reinforced by this, and so they might actually appreciate it. And so they don\x92t think too deeply about the issue of sordid coordination between one campaign and one corporate media outlet.\x94 Tracey said. \x93If you\x92re a highly engaged consumer of news, and you have some critical faculties in terms of how you analyze it, then you can kind of understand the basic cynicism of this stunt.\x94
Tracey continued,\x94But for others, they\x92re sort of more casual news consumers. They\x92ll just glance at a headline or they\x92ll see some highlight clips, and they\x92ll say, \x91Whoa! Bernie\x92s long-time ally who I thought he agreed with on most things is now saying that he was a closet misogynist. Wow, that\x92s kind of bad for Bernie, right?\x92 So that\x92s one breed of primary voter, and there\x92s another, again, this kind of highly engaged set, many of whom you\x92ll see debating online who now, I think, feel like Warren has showed her true colors if she\x92s willing to, again, actively collude with this corporate media outlet to maximize the damage inflicted on the most unapologetic socialist candidate that the Democratic Party has fielded in modern history.\x94
\x93Even if you don\x92t agree with socialism, right, you have to acknowledge that\x92s sort of a remarkable development, and people who are onboard with that project are going to be extremely defensive if they feel like they\x92re being ganged up upon in a way that is not ethical,\x94 added Tracey. \x93I hope it just reinforces that there is no need fundamentally, for these corporate media outlets to pay such an outsized role in the process.\x94
CNN\x92s coordination with Warren may increase public skepticism of the broader news media, estimated Tracey,
\x93The cravenness of this exercise is going to cause people to reevaluate how they think about the role of the media in relation to the candidates,\x94 Tracey predicted. \x93If even somebody [like Elizabeth Warren] who is seen as this stalwart progressive ally could engage in one of the most egregious calculated hit jobs that we\x92ve ever really seen in modern political history, I think it\x92s just going to increase [voters\x92] level of alienation from the predominant means by which political media are transmitted.\x94

b"Eighteen left-wing groups, including Justice Democrats, the Working Families Party, and Sunrise Movement, signed a unity pledge this week as a response to the growing tension between Sens. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) and Bernie Sanders (I-VT).
The groups, some of which back Sanders and others of which endorsed Warren, are urging Democrats to remain united and focus their criticisms on President Trump and \x93corporate\x94 Democrats. They outlined their call to action in their \x93Progressive Unity Statement\x94 released this week.


\x93For those with a declared preference, this statement in no way signals the slightest decrease in that commitment,\x94 the groups said of their previous endorsements, contending that the statement is \x93a shared declaration of our belief that the surest way to defeat Trump is for the Democratic Party to nominate either Warren or Sanders, as these are the candidates best able to energize voters by providing a vision of a decent society and a fair economy.\x94
The pledge states in part:
Our best chance of defeating Trump does not lie with an establishment or corporate Democrat. The anti-establishment, anti-corporate awareness and anger that characterize American society today are justified, and it would be a huge mistake to once again yield that ground to a phony like Trump. We can do better, and will work to persuade Democrats to choose a strong, progressive nominee.
Sanders and Warren, as well as their campaigns and supporters, will need to find ways to cooperate. The crossfire amplified by the media is unhelpful and does not reflect the relationship between two Senate colleagues who broadly worked well together for most of the last year. We hope to build solidarity between delegates affiliated with these two candidates prior to the convention and will encourage the campaigns to work towards a unified convention strategy after the final primaries on June 2nd.
While groups added that they believe Sanders and Warren are the candidates who should lead the country, they pledged to \x93go all-out to defeat Trump no matter who the Democratic nominee is\x94 and urged other progressives to do the same.

Eighteen groups signed the pledge, including Center for Popular Democracy Action, Dream Defenders, Our Revolution, People\x92s Action, Progressive Democrats of America, Roots Action, and the Sunrise Movement, all of which endorsed Sanders, and the Working Families Party and Progressive Change Campaign Committee, which endorsed Warren.
Unpledged groups include the Be a Hero Action Fund, Black Male Voter Project, Black Voters Matter Fund, Democracy for America, Inequality Media Civic Action, Justice Democrats, Presente Action, Progress America, and Social Security Works.
The call for unity follows a wave of infighting capitalized by Tuesday\x92s Democrat debate in Des Moines, Iowa.
CNN\x92s Abby Phillip asked Sanders about the report alleging he told Warren during a private meeting in 2018 that he did not believe a woman could secure the presidency. Sanders denied the allegation prior to the debate and during the debate. Nonetheless, Phillip asked Warren about the rumored conversation, presenting the allegation against Sanders as fact.
\x93Sen. Warren, what did you think when Sen. Sanders told you a woman could not win the election?\x94 she asked.

\x93I disagreed,\x94 Warren said, taking no issue with the way Phillip framed the question.
The Massachusetts senator refused to shake Sanders\x92 hand following the debate, signaling icy tensions between the two.
\x93I think you called me a liar on national TV,\x94 she told Sanders.
\x93You know, let\x92s not do it right now. If you want to have that discussion, we\x92ll have that discussion,\x94 Sanders said.
\x93You called me a liar. You told me \x97 all right, let\x92s not do it now,\x94 he added, walking away:

That exchange was emblematic of the rising tensions within the Democrat Party. CNN faced a flurry of criticism for \x93rigging\x94 the debate against Sanders, and #NeverWarren, #WarrenIsASnake, and #CNNIsTrash trended after the two-hour event.
Sanders\x92 wife, Jane, is also calling for party unity, making her plea in a tweet posted Wednesday afternoon:

The @BernieSanders campaign is about unifying people across our country \x96 not dividing them up by race, ethnicity or gender. Forget those who are trying to divide us, focus on building the progressive movement & be positive to succeed!#MenWomenUnited
\x97 Jane O'Meara Sanders (@janeosanders) January 15, 2020"

b'Way back in 2015, when the rumors began to circulate about Donald Trump running for president, rumors we had heard for decades, I was shocked at how many \x93smart people\x94 \x97 those snobs I enjoy heckling as \x93#GOPSmartSet\x94 \x97 underestimated The Donald.
Shrugging off the idea Trump would actually run was fair enough. Like I said, he\x92d been flirting with the idea for decades. Even I would have bet it was a publicity stunt.


No, what surprised me was how #GOPSmartSet and the elite media laughed off Trump as a clown, a huckster, a carnival barker, and bankrupt loser. That, to me, was wholly ridiculous.
To begin with, Trump was in his fourth decade of pop culture relevance. Other than Oprah, how many Americans have remained relevant since the eighties, are more than a nostalgia act today?
On top of that, Trump was not only a potent brand, but with his skyscrapers, he had single-handedly altered the landscapes of some of the biggest cities in the world, he had come back from the brink of bankruptcy (no small thing), he had conquered the Manhattan real estate market (the most competitive and cutthroat in the world), he was in his 14th year \x97 fourteen! \x97 of The Apprentice, a primetime hit on a major broadcast network, and he was a bestselling author.

Unless you\x92re a fool, and let\x92s face it, most of America\x92s political and media \x93experts\x94 are fools, you don\x92t write off a man like that.
What\x92s more, on the political front, Trump single-handedly muscled Barack Obama into producing his birth certificate. Trump bucked the media, bucked the political establishment, and forced Obama\x92s hand. I\x92ve never believed for a moment Obama was born anywhere but the U.S., but Trump\x92s effectiveness, his fearlessness and skill with this third rail, blew my mind. Trump also stripped the media and Democrats of the \x93birther\x94 weapon, which is why they fought so bitterly against the simple production of that document. The left loved the birther weapon, and now \x97 thanks to Trump\x92s political and media skills \x97 it was gone.
Nevertheless\x85
Had you asked me in 2015 if Trump had a chance at winning the nomination, much less the presidency, I would have said no, and probably did on a number of occasions. My point is that even I underestimated the guy. But here we are in the fourth year of Trump\x92s objectively successful presidency, and he is still surprising our idiotic \x93experts,\x94 he\x92s still underestimated, and he\x92s still doing what we are told is impossible.
So I thought the signing of the first phase of the China trade deal would be a good time to jump in the Wayback Machine and give our stupid and useless \x93experts\x94 a face job \x97 to look back at all the things our corrupt political and media \x93experts\x94 assured and reassured us Trump could not or would not do \x85 just before he went ahead and did.

If I\x92m missing any, feel free to complete the list in the comments\x85

 Trump Won\x92t Run for President

All the experts laughed and chortled at the very idea of Trump running for president.

Trump then announced his run for president.

Trump Won\x92t File His Personal Financial Disclosure Forms

After Trump made his announcement, the \x93experts\x94 said it was all a public relations move because Trump would never file the personal financial disclosure forms required to run.
Trump filed his personal financial disclosure forms with a statement laughing at the \x93experts\x94 who swore he never would.


Trump Can\x92t Win the Republican Nomination

Even as Trump racked up one primary win after another, #GOPSmartSet continued to tell us Trump had no chance of winning the nomination. In fact, with every Trump victory, #GOPSmartSet kept telling us these wins were actually good news for #GOPSmartSet favorite Marco Rubio, who didn\x92t even win his home state of Florida.
Trump not only won the nomination, he entered the race in first place and never relinquished it. That\x92s just how useless our experts are.

Trump Can\x92t Win the Presidency

The idea that Trump had no chance of beating Hillary Clinton in the general election was not just a prediction, it was dogma. In fact, it was such a closely held dogma, when Mark Halperin tried to explain on Morning Joe why Trump had a chance, he was berated and shamed until he shut up.
Trump won the presidency.

Trump Can\x92t Win Pennsylvania, Wisconsin, or Michigan

The Democrat Big Blue Electoral Wall of Pennsylvania, Wisconsin, or Michigan could never be breached, the experts told us.
Trump won all three of those states.

Trump\x92s Victory Will Crash the Stock Market

After Trump won the presidency, a whole host of hysterical economic \x93experts\x94 told us Trump would crash the stock market, most especially the dumbest shit of all, Pulitzer Prize winner Paul Krugman.
The market is not only soaring, it seems to hit a new high almost every week.

Trump Won\x92t Build a Border Wall

At first, the \x93experts\x94 told us Trump was conning us rubes with the promise of a border wall. Then, after Congress and the courts did everything possible to block wall construction, the \x93experts\x94 told us it was impossible for Trump to build the wall.
Trump is building the wall.

Trump Will Never Get Mexico to Pay for the Wall

The \x93experts\x94 told us Trump was lying about Mexico paying for the wall.
Well, to be perfectly fair, so far the experts are half right, but Mexico is indeed paying to protect our southern border with a human wall of 27,000 Mexican National Guard troops. If Trump had made a campaign promise Mexico would agree to that, the \x93experts\x94 would have laughed just as hard.

Trump Can\x92t Bring Manufacturing Jobs Back to America

In a classic Barack \x93Manage the American Decline\x94 Obama moment, the former and failed president told the American people Trump would need a \x93magic wand\x94 to bring back manufacturing jobs. Naturally, all of our stupid and useless \x93experts\x94 agreed.
Meanwhile, Trump is bringing back American manufacturing jobs.

Trump Will Never Get Mexico and Canada to Replace NAFTA

Trump not only replaced NAFTA, Democrats in Congress have ratified the new trade deal and the Senate is about to make it the law of the land.
This is a massive accomplishment for Trump. I remember Trump railing against NAFTA back in \x9293 when it was first passed.

Trump\x92s Tariffs Will Destroy the Economy

To force the world\x92s trade cheaters, like China, to come to the table, Trump defied every \x93expert\x94 by imposing tariffs.
For decades we have been told tariffs will destroy the American economy with higher prices, inflation, etc.; \xa0that there was no way to win a trade war with tariffs, that the damage to our economy made such a war futile.
Trump defied this thinking, defied the entire world, imposed his tariffs, and lo and behold, the tariffs hardly had any effect on anything. Our economy is robust and growing.
It was also the threat of tariffs that forced Mexico to pay for that human wall I mentioned above.

Trump Can\x92t Win a Trade War with China

The experts told us the tariffs on China would destroy the economy, China would never come to the table, China held all the cards.
That was the conventional wisdom across the fruited plain, and once again Trump defied the world. He blistered China with tariffs and as our economy grew and grew and grew, China\x92s economy took a hellacious beating. Finally, on Wednesday, the first phase of a trade deal with China was signed, a deal that mostly benefits the United States.
Yes, the Chinese are notorious cheaters. Yes, there needs to be enforcement, not just a victory lap. Yes, this is just the first phase.
But Trump did it when everyone said there was no way anything with China was possible. And if he wins reelection, I suspect enforcement and a final deal are more than possible.

Trump Can\x92t Remove Troops from Syria

Our stupid and corrupt \x93experts,\x94 especially among the wretched neocons in #GOPSmartSet, assured us Trump\x92s decision to remove our troops from Syria would 1) cause World War III, 2) result in a Kurdish holocaust, and 3) bring back the military draft.
And then Trump ended up solving a Turkey-Syria border dispute older than Bernie Sanders.

Trump Will Never Move the American Embassy to Jerusalem

Trump moved the American embassy to Jerusalem.

Trump\x92s Move of the American Embassy to Jerusalem Will Be an International Catastrophe 

Our stupid and corrupt \x93experts\x94 told us the embassy move would 1) cause World War III, 2) result in another Jewish holocaust, and 3) bring back the military draft.
The actual result was that no one cared, not even the infamous \x93Arab Street.\x94

Trump Will Never Make America Energy Independent

Trump\x92s de-regulation, the fracking miracle he protects against the enviro-nuts, and the opening of once stupidly sacred places like the Alaska National Wildlife Reserve, have made America energy independent, an energy exporter.

Trump Can\x92t Tame North Korea

The experts assured us Trump\x92s approach to North Korea, a mix of flattery and saber rattling, was the work of a rank amateur and destined to fail. And then\x85
Trump got our hostages back, the remains of American soldiers were finally returned, and North Korea has stopped threatening its neighbors and firing off missiles.
What\x92s more, Trump accomplished all of this without the appeasement of sanction relief.

Trump Can\x92t Lower the Unemployment Rate

The \x93experts\x94 told us America was at \x93full employment\x94 under their Precious Barry Obama.
Then Trump\x92s economy proved that a lie with record low unemployment rates, including for blacks and Hispanics.

Trump Can\x92t Boost the GDP

To justify their Precious Barry\x92s dismal economic \x93recovery,\x94 the \x93experts\x94 told us 1.5 percent GDP growth was the new normal.
Ahem.

Trump Can\x92t Increase Working Class Wages

Ahem.

Trump Will Never Get NATO to Pay Its Fair Share

Ahem.
23.\xa0Trump Will Never Pull Out of the Trans-Pacific Partnership Trade Deal
Ahem.

Trump\x92s Droning of Iran Terror Master Soleimani Will Result in Disaster

After Trump killed Iran\x92s top terrorist, Qasem Soleimani, with a drone strike, all of America\x92s \x93experts\x94 told us this would 1) cause World War III, 2) result in some kind of holocaust somewhere, and 3) bring back the military draft.
Instead, at least so far, after one increasingly aggressive move after another, Iran has de-escalated its attacks.
Meanwhile, Trump increased sanctions on the terrorist regime.
And finally, my favorite\x85

Trump Will Resign and Not Run for Reelection

Good grief, \x93Experts\x94 \x97 have a little dignity, and you might start with a healthy serving of STFU.
\xa0

b'Socialist gangs loyal to Venezuelan dictator Nicol\xe1s Maduro attacked a convoy of opposition lawmakers outside the country\x92s National Assembly in Caracas on Wednesday, consequently preventing them from entering the building for the second time this month.
The convoy of vehicles came under attack as the lawmakers approached the chamber. Video footage from within one of the cars showed militants chasing the vehicle, throwing stones and hitting it with a traffic cone, shattering the rear window.


Local media also reported sounds of people opening fire.\xa0The convoy eventually sped away, followed by several individuals on motorbikes.
Opposition lawmaker Angelo Palmeri said the cars were also hit with metal bars and bats. He blamed the attack on the Venezuelan National Guard for comprising their security.
\x93This was done while the National Guard watched complacently,\x94 said Palmieri.\xa0\x93I was surprised to find that the National Guard waved us through several checkpoints, then we were surrounded by this mob and I understood why we\x92d been let through.\x94

b'An unchallenged China will herald in \x93a dystopian future in which no one is beyond the reach of Chinese censors, and an international human rights system so weakened that it no longer serves as a check on government repression,\x94 Human Rights Watch warned in its annual report on the country published Wednesday.
The 2020 China report from the non-governmental organization (NGO) accused both states friendly to China and corporations that do business with it of \x93enabling\x94 China\x92s increased use of violence and systematic state repression to silence political dissidents, religious groups, and ethnic minorities. Human Rights Watch published the report shortly after Beijing banned its executive director, Kenneth Roth, from traveling to Hong Kong for an event to release it.


Roth presented the report at an event in New York at the United Nations headquarters instead, despite the report being heavily critical of the U.N. as an institution. The report also attempted to criticize President Donald Trump for referring in friendly terms to Chinese dictator Xi Jinping, but ultimately conceded that \x93the\xa0Trump administration is one government that has been willing to stand up to China, best evidenced by its October 2019 imposition of sanctions on the Xinjiang Public Security Bureau and eight Chinese technology companies for their complicity in human rights violations.\x94
Human Rights Watch extended its usual focus on how China violates the human rights of its citizens to how \x93willing accomplices\x94 leading foreign nations and businesses empower China to do so.
\x93China\x92s government sees human rights as an existential threat. Its reaction could pose an existential threat to the rights of people worldwide,\x94 Roth wrote. \x93If not challenged, Beijing\x92s actions portend a dystopian future in which no one is beyond the reach of Chinese censors, and an international human rights system so weakened that it no longer serves as a check on government repression.\x94

He continued:
Far from being spurned as a global pariah, the Chinese government is courted the world over, its unelected president receiving red-carpet treatment wherever he goes, and the country hosting prestigious events, such as the 2022 Winter Olympics. The aim is to portray China as open, welcoming, and powerful, even as it descends into ever more ruthless autocratic rule.
[\x85]
Although China is the driving force behind this global assault on human rights, it has willing accomplices. They include a collection of dictators, autocrats, and monarchs who themselves have an abiding interesting in undermining the human rights system that might hold them to account. They also include governments, as well as companies and even academic institutions, that are ostensibly committed to human rights but prioritize access to China\x92s wealth.
Among the examples noted in the report are Muslim states friendly to China who have ignored the establishment of concentration camps for Turkic Muslims \x96 mostly Uyghurs, but Kazakhs, Kyrgyz, and other Turkic people as well \x96 in Xinjiang, China\x92s westernmost province. The Pentagon estimated last year that China has imprisoned as many as 3 million Muslims in concentration camps, where they endure rape, torture, slavery, and communist indoctrination. Survivors have told human rights groups that they witnessed commonplace rape of young men and women, suffered electroshock torture, and were forced into painful abortions and sterilizations.
\x93No other government is simultaneously detaining a million members of an ethnic minority for forced indoctrination and attacking anyone who dares to challenge its repression,\x94 Human Rights Watch noted. \x93And while other governments commit serious human rights violations, no other government flexes its political muscles with such vigor and determination to undermine the international human rights standards and institutions that could hold it to account.\x94
The Human Rights Watch report condemned the Organization of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) \x96 with the notable exceptions of Turkey and Albania \x96 for applauding China\x92s use of concentration camps against fellow Muslims.
\x93One would have hoped that the Organization of Islamic Cooperation (OIC)\x97the group of 57 mostly Muslim-majority nations\x97would come to the defense of the persecuted Muslims of Xinjiang, as they did for the Rohingya Muslims ethnically cleansed by the Myanmar military,\x94 the report asserted. \x93Instead, the OIC issued a fawning panegyric, commending China for \x91providing care to its Muslim citizens.\x92 Pakistan\x97despite its role as OIC coordinator and its corresponding responsibility to speak out against abuses faced by Muslims\x97has championed such efforts.\x94

The report also condemns leaders in the West, such as French President Emmanuel Macron and United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres, for keeping silent about human rights abuses in Xinjiang.
Outside of China\x92s \x93cheerleader states,\x94 Human Rights Watch expressed alarm at China\x92s increasingly common bullying of international corporations when its members criticize Beijing outside of China\x92s borders. The NGO highlighted the incident last year in which the Houston Rockets NBA team apologized profusely for its general manager, Daryl Morey, posting a statement of support to pro-democracy protesters in Hong Kong on his Twitter page.
According to the report:
The result [of China\x92s bullying] is that any non-Chinese government or company seeking to do business with China, if it publicly opposes Beijing\x92s repression, faces not a series of individual Chinese companies\x92 decisions about how to respond but a single central command, with access to the entire Chinese market\x9716 percent of the world economy\x97at stake. For example, after the Houston Rockets general manager irked the Chinese government by tweeting his support for Hong Kong\x92s pro-democracy protesters, all of the National Basketball Association\x92s 11 official Chinese business partners\x97including a travel website, a milk producer, and a fast-food chain\x97suspended ties with the league.
\x93Beijing has taken full advantage of the corporate quest for profit to extend its censorship to critics abroad,\x94 the report concluded.
The human rights NGO urged \x93governments, companies, universities, international institutions, and others [to] stand with those in and from China who are struggling to secure their rights.\x94 It also requested that nations sanction China for its human rights atrocities, saying, \x93Their foreign bank accounts should be frozen. They should fear prosecution for their crimes. And the Chinese companies that build and help run the detention camps in Xinjiang, and any company that exploits the labor of prisoners or provides the surveillance infrastructure and big data processing, should be exposed and pressured to stop.\x94

b'The White House violated the law by temporarily withholding U.S. military aid to Ukraine, said a Government Accountability Office report published on Thursday.
\x93In the summer of 2019, the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) withheld from obligation funds appropriated to the Department of Defense (DOD) for security assistance to Ukraine,\x94 the eight-page watchdog report read.


\x93Faithful execution of the law does not permit the President to substitute his own policy priorities for those that Congress has enacted into law. OMB withheld funds for a policy reason, which is not permitted under the Impoundment Control Act (ICA). The withholding was not a programmatic delay. Therefore, we conclude that OMB violated the ICA,\x94 it concluded.
The Office of Management and Budget placed a hold on the aid on July 25, \x93pending a policy decision,\x94 and was lifted on September 12,\xa0the office\x92s general counsel Mark Paoletta has said.\xa0Paoletta wrote in a December letter to the GAO that the hold was a\xa0\x93programmatic delay,\x94 and thus, Congress did not require prior notice of the move.
The OMB issued a statement in response to the report\x92s findings, reaffirming that the hold was appropriate.

\x93We disagree with GAO\x92s opinion. OMB uses its apportionment authority to ensure taxpayer dollars are properly spent consistent with the President\x92s priorities and with the law,\x94 OMB spokeswoman Rachel Semmel said.
In a separate statement, Department of Defense spokesman Jon Hoffman defended the decision to place a temporary hold on the aid, noting it ultimately \x93got out with no detriment to our national security.\x94
The report comes one day after House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) sent to articles of impeachment against the president \x97 abuse of power and obstruction of Congress \x97 to the Senate amid pressure from Republicans and several\xa0Democrats in the upper chamber. In addition to transferring the articles, the speaker also named the seven House Democrats who will serve as impeachment managers in the Senate\x92s impeachment trial, selecting:\xa0House Intelligence Committee Chairman Rep.\xa0Adam Schiff (D-CA), House Judiciary Committee Chairman Rep.\xa0Jerry Nadler (D-NY), and Reps. Hakeem Jeffries (D-NY), Val Demings (D-FL),\xa0Zoe Lofgren\xa0(D-CA), Jason Crow (D-CO), and Sylvia Garcia (D-TX). Schiff will take on the role of lead impeachment manager.
Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY) said Tuesday that \x93in all likelihood,\x94 the trial will begin next Tuesday.
\x93We\x92ll be able to go through some preliminary steps here this week, which could well include the Chief Justice coming over and swearing-in members of the Senate and some other kind of housekeeping measures\x85which would set us up to begin the actual trial next Tuesday,\x94 McConnell said at a press conference.
Pelosi unveiled a formal impeachment inquiry after a partisan CIA analyst alleged in a whistleblower complaint that President Trump pressured Ukraine\x92s president to review allegations of corruption against former Vice President Joe Biden and his son, Hunter Biden, in an attempted exchange for U.S. military assistance. President Trump and Ukrainian President\xa0Volodymyr Zelensky have repeatedly denied any pressure was applied during their July 25 telephone call and the White House published transcripts of the world leaders\x92 call as evidence that no wrongdoing occurred.
Last month, a top aide to Zelensky, confirmed that the eastern European country never believed that U.S. military aid was tied to any investigations.
\x93We never had that feeling,\x94\xa0Andriy Yermak\xa0told\xa0TIME\xa0magazine. \x93We had a clear understanding that the aid has been frozen. We honestly said, \x91Okay, that\x92s bad, what\x92s going on here.\x92 We were told that they would figure it out. And after a certain amount of time the aid was unfrozen. We did not have the feeling that this aid was connected to any one specific issue.\x94
President Trump has repeatedly slammed the impeachment process as a \x93hoax\x94 and an \x93illegal, partisan attempted coup.\x94'

b'The White House Office of Management and Budget (OMB) sent a memorandum Wednesday to the Government Accountability Office (GAO) explaining the legal foundations and reasons for holding up U.S. security assistance to Ukraine over the summer.
The\xa0Washington Post reported the existence of the memorandum and published it on Thursday morning; it was largely overlooked in in favor of the day\x92s lengthy impeachment debate in the House Judiciary Committee. Yet the memo fills in some of the factual gaps in the account of what happened.


In the memo to GAO, which works for Congress, the OMB begins by explaining that it often holds up funding to federal agencies in the regular course of business under its apportionment authority, often for reasons as mundane as making sure funding is being spent efficiently.

However, there are different methods of holding up funds. One is \x93deferral,\x94 which is still subject to the provisions of the Impoundment Control Act, which requires the president to inform Congress. The other way in which funds may be held is \x93programmatic delay,\x94 in which the president withholds funds while developing policies around the funds. A \x93deferral\x94 runs\xa0against the intent for which Congress appropriates money; a \x93programmatic delay\x94 works\xa0in favor of congressional intent. OMB argues that both practices have a lengthy, legitimate history.
Without delving into details, the OMB explains that the hold on aid to Ukraine was a \x93programmatic delay\x94:
The pause in obligations of the Ukraine funds at issue here is an example of programmatic delay. \x85 It was OMB\x92s understanding that a brief period was needed, prior to the funds expiring, to engage in a policy process regarding those funds. OMB took appropriate action, in light of a pending policy process, to ensure that funds were not obligated prematurely in a manner that could conflict with the President\x92s foreign policy.
The OMB memo notes wryly in a footnote that the executive has sometimes held up funding beyond the statutory deadline at the request of the legislature itself: \x94\xa0OMB is aware of instances in which Members of Congress demanded that agencies withhold funds for months\x97 and even years\x97beyond the period required by statute for reasons wholly unrelated to the purpose of the appropriation.\x94
Again and again, witnesses before the House Intelligence Committee were asked about disputes between the OMB, the Department of Defense, and the Department of State about whether the hold on funds was legal. The issue was never cleared up.
What the OMB memo argues, however, is that the hold on aid \x97 regardless of what the Ukraine did, or knew \x97 was not meant to defy Congress\x92s intent to help Ukraine, but to make sure the money actually did.

b'Democrats are suddenly obsessed with Lev Parnas, the Rudy Giuliani associate who was indicted on federal campaign charges last fall.
The Ukrainian-born Parnas was a gopher for Giuliani, President Donald Trump\x92s personal lawyer, who wanted to investigate possible leads in preparing a defense against charges of Russia collusion.


Parnas agreed to testify during the House impeachment inquiry, and a federal judge let him hand over documents and text messages last week.
But it is not clear Parnas has anything to offer.
House Intelligence Committee Chairman Rep. Adam Schiff (D-CA) is dumping documents, and MSNBC\x92s Rachel Maddow did her best in an interview with Parnas on Wednesday evening.

However, there are serious questions about Parnas\x92s credibility, and many of his claims about Trump are dubious or contradicted by other evidence.
Here are ten key facts about Parnas\x92s \x93evidence,\x94 as provided to Maddow:
1. This is the Michael Cohen playbook. We have seen this movie before. A year ago, Democrats staged a hearing with disgraced former Trump \x93fixer\x94 Michael Cohen, who had already pleaded guilty on federal campaign finance charges. Cohen, who had also pleaded guilty to lying to Congress, provided nothing of value to Democrats in his testimony. They seem to hope this time will be different, once again using a desperate and dubious witness to fling dirt at the president.
2. Rachel Maddow has no credibility. Maddow\x92s reputation has never recovered from her years-long obsession with the \x93Russia collusion\x94 conspiracy theory. In fact, she continues to obsess about it: last month, she tried to link Russia to Trump\x92s alleged effort to pressure Ukraine. In 2017, Maddow earned mockery from the left for releasing one of Trump\x92s tax returns, showing merely that he paid a lot of taxes. Parnas could not have chosen a worse forum if he wanted to be taken seriously.
3. Parnas claims he acted at Trump\x92s direction. The problem is that Parnas\x92s only evidence of that is that Ukrainian officials agreed to meet with him. \x93They have no reason to speak to\xa0me. \x85 Who am I?\x94 He offered no evidence of private or direct conversations with Trump. Though he claims Trump is lying about not knowing him, the best Parnas offered Maddow was conversations at \x93roundtables\x94 \x97 i.e. with many others present \x97 and overhearing Giulaini talking to the president.

4. Parnas claims that Trump knew about Giuliani\x92s investigations, which were \x93never about corruption\x94 in general. We already know, from the closed-door testimony of Catherine Croft (whom Democrats deliberately omitted from public hearings), that Trump had an independent concern about corruption in Ukraine, and raised it with the previous president.\xa0We also know that Giuliani\x92s task was preparing a legal defense for Trump, one Trump knew about. Nothing about that is new.
5. Parnas claims that he presented himself to Ukrainian officials as the president\x92s representative.\xa0Unfortunately for Maddow, he presented himself as working for the president\x92s personal attorney \x97 something he said that Giuliani reiterated in every interaction with Ukrainian officials. Neither Parnas nor Giuliani ever presented themselves as representing the U.S. And as Trump\x92s personal attorney, Giuliani had an ethical obligation to investigate whatever he could to help his client.
6. Parnas claims that he conveyed a threat to Ukrainian official Sergei Shaffer.\xa0Parnas said that he told Shaffer, an aide to President Volodymyr Zelesnky, that all U.S. aid was at risk unless Ukraine announced an investigation into former Vice President Joe Biden. The claim contrasts with claims by President Zelensky himself, who has said numerous times that he felt no pressure from the United States whatsoever, and that there was never any \x93quid pro quo\x94 tied to U.S. assistance.
7. Parnas claims that Vice\xa0President Mike Pence stayed away from Zelensky\x92s inauguration to apply pressure. Pence flatly denied that on Wednesday. In addition, testimony by Pence aide Jennifer Williams suggested scheduling conflicts were an issue. (She also said she had heard Trump told Pence not to attend, but did not know why.) Parnas also said Trump did not cancel a Poland trip because of a hurricane \x97 a dubious claim, given the political importance of hurricanes in the U.S.
8. Parnas actually shut down Maddow\x92s\xa0claims about \x93menacing\x94 text messages about former U.S. Ambassador to Ukraine Marie Yovanovitch. Democrats accused a former Republican congressional candidate, a man named Robert Hyde, of conducting mob-style surveillance on Yovanovitch. But Parnas said he never took Hyde\x92s texts seriously because he was \x93a weird character,\x94 and \x93he was\xa0always drunk,\x94 starting at 6:00 in the morning. \x93I\x92ve never seen him not\xa0drunk.\x94
9. Parnas claims Attorney General William Barr was \x93on the team\x94 in Ukraine.\xa0Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) referred to that claim in her press briefing Wednesday morning, saying Barr was \x93implicated.\x94 But Parnas said he never spoke to Barr, and did not know whether Barr had ever spoken to any Ukrainian officials. President Trump had told Zelensky that Barr would work with him \x97 which would be entirely legal, but which supposedly never happened anyway.
10.\xa0Maddow never asked Parnas about CNN\x92s claim about Devin Nunes going to Vienna.\xa0Recently, House Intelligence Committee Ranking Member Rep. Devin Nunes (R-CA) sued CNN for defamation for claiming he had gone to Vienna to meet with a former Ukrainian prosecutor. Parnas was allegedly CNN\x92s source, the lawsuit states. (Nunes says that he was in Benghazi, Libya at the time.) Maddow asked about Nunes, but not about that; Parnas said he did not know Nunes too well.

b'NEW YORK (AP) \x97 Carlos Beltr\xe1n is out as manager of the New York Mets before a single game, the latest fallout from the Houston Astros\x92 sign-stealing scandal that has rocked Major League Baseball.
The Mets announced the decision Thursday in a news release, saying Beltr\xe1n and the team \x93agreed to mutually part ways.\x94 The move came two days after Boston cut ties with manager Alex Cora, who was Houston\x92s bench coach in 2017 when Beltr\xe1n played for the Astros.


A day before that, manager AJ Hinch and general manager Jeff Luhnow were fired by Houston soon after they were suspended for the 2020 season by Commissioner Rob Manfred for their roles in the cheating scheme.
Next to fall was Beltr\xe1n, the only Astros player mentioned by name Monday when MLB issued its findings from an investigation into the club\x92s conduct. No players were disciplined, but the nine-page report said Beltr\xe1n was among the group involved in the team\x92s illicit use of electronics to pilfer signs during Houston\x92s run to the 2017 World Series championship.
\x93We met with Carlos last night and again this morning and agreed to mutually part ways. This was not an easy decision,\x94 Mets general manager Brodie Van Wagenen and Chief Operating Officer Jeff Wilpon said in a statement.

\x93Considering the circumstances, it became clear to all parties that it was not in anyone\x92s best interest for Carlos to move forward as manager of the New York Mets. We believe that Carlos was honest and forthcoming with us. We are confident that this will not be the final chapter in his baseball career. We remain excited about the talent on this team and are committed to reaching our goals of winning now and in the future.\x94
On a later conference call, Wilpon said the team had heard in advance \x93from sources\x94 that Beltr\xe1n wasn\x92t going to be suspended by MLB.
\x93I think the change was that when the report did come out, how prominent he was in it,\x94 Wilpon said.
The Mets said they will consider a number of internal and external candidates to be their next manager.
The 42-year-old Beltr\xe1n, with no managerial experience, was hired to replace Mickey Callaway as Mets manager on Nov. 1. The former New York slugger was given a three-year contract with a club option for 2023 and introduced three days later by Van Wagenen and Wilpon during a news conference at Citi Field.

\x93At a meeting this morning with Jeff and Brodie we mutually agreed to part ways. I\x92m grateful to them for giving me the opportunity, but we agreed this decision is in the best interest of the team. I couldn\x92t let myself be a distraction for the team. I wish the entire organization success in the future,\x94 Beltr\xe1n said in the statement.
Beltr\xe1n becomes the first manager to be let go without managing a game since Wally Backman, who was hired by Arizona in November 2004 and fired four days later after legal and financial problems were revealed.

When the Mets hired Beltran in November, Van Wagenen said: \x93We can trust Carlos, and that goes a long way.\x94
A little more than two months later, Beltr\xe1n is out in the wake of transgressions that occurred with a different organization, according to MLB.
And the Mets are looking for a new manager again. They will be the 10th team to change managers since opening day of last year, with the Mets making a pair of switches.

Beltr\xe1n played the last of his 20 big league seasons with the Astros in 2017. Manfred said that year Cora was \x93an active participant\x94 and developed the sign-stealing system used by the team, strongly hinting he will face severe penalties. Even though Cora was subsequently let go, the Red Sox remain under investigation for stealing signs during Cora\x92s first season as manager in 2018, when they won the World Series.
In a Nov. 12 report by The Athletic, ex-Astros pitcher Mike Fiers, now with Oakland, went public with allegations that Houston players used a camera to steal signs in 2017. That prompted baseball\x92s investigation, which found the Astros used the video feed from center field to see and decode the opposing catcher\x92s signs. Players banged on a trash can to signal batters what kind of pitch was coming, believing it would improve their chances of getting a hit.
Beltr\xe1n told the New York Post in a text message he was \x93not aware of that camera.\x94 He told The Athletic the Astros \x93took a lot of pride\x94 in studying pitchers via computer before games but insisted \x93that is the only technology that I use.\x94
Attempting to steal signs with the naked eye is a legal and time-honored part of baseball \x97 but using technology during games is prohibited.
(In) the game of baseball, guys for years have given location and if the catchers get lazy and the pitcher doesn\x92t cover the signs from second base, of course players are going to take advantage,\x94 Beltr\xe1n said then. \x93I don\x92t call that cheating. I call that using the small details to take advantage. I think baseball is doing a great job adding new technology to make sure the game is even for both teams.\x94
Manfred said Hinch failed to stop the sign stealing in Houston and Luhnow was responsible for the players\x92 conduct even though he made the dubious claim he was not aware. Manfred said owner Jim Crane was not informed.
Manfred also said no Astros players will be punished because he decided in September 2017 to hold a team\x92s manager and GM responsible for sign-stealing infractions, a warning that was conveyed to all major league clubs.
\x93Virtually all of the Astros\x92 players had some involvement or knowledge of the scheme, and I am not in a position based on the investigative record to determine with any degree of certainty every player who should be held accountable,\x94 Manfred said.
The report, however, indicated a group that included Beltr\xe1n discussed how to improve the sign-stealing system during the 2017 season.
Hinch and Luhnow, before they were fired by Crane, were suspended for the 2020 season without pay. Houston was fined $5 million, the maximum allowed under the Major League Constitution, and the Astros also will forfeit their next two first- and second-round amateur draft picks.
A nine-time All-Star, Beltr\xe1n signed a $119 million, seven-year contract with the Mets in January 2005 and helped them win the NL East in 2006. But the switch-hitting outfielder took a called third strike with the bases loaded against Adam Wainwright that ended New York\x92s 3-1 loss to St. Louis in Game 7 of the 2006 NL Championship Series.
Beltr\xe1n played for the Mets from 2005-11 before they traded him to San Francisco. He finished his career with a .279 batting average, 435 home runs, 1,587 RBIs and 312 stolen bases for Kansas City, Houston, the Mets, San Francisco, St. Louis, the Yankees and Texas. He interviewed to become New York Yankees manager after the 2017 season, when Aaron Boone was hired, and spent the 2019 season as an adviser to Yankees general manager Brian Cashman.
Last month, the Mets hired Hensley Meulens as bench coach and Tony DeFrancesco as first base coach to fill out Beltr\xe1n\x92s staff. Meulens, 52, was San Francisco\x92s hitting coach from 2010-17, then was Bruce Bochy\x92s bench coach for the past two seasons. DeFrancesco, 56, spent the last two seasons as the Mets\x92 Triple-A manager and interviewed for the manager opening.
New York went 86-76 last season and missed the playoffs, finishing third in the NL East behind Atlanta and World Series champion Washington.'

\x93Two of the three suspected drug smugglers attempted to overpower the Agent by assaulting her, restraining her, and trying to prevent her from drawing her service weapon or calling for assistance with her service radio,\x94 the Facebook post continues. \x93The Agent managed to resist the attacks and draw her service weapon.\x94

The agent reportedly secured the three migrants of the family but the two suspected drug smugglers escaped to Mexico.
Breitbart Texas reached out to U.S. Customs and Border Protection officials to confirm the facts laid out by the union officials.
\x93On January 10, 2020, two detainees escaped Border Patrol custody and fled to Mexico,\x94 a CBP spokesman said in a written response. \x93An agent was pushed to the ground during the altercation, but was uninjured. The incident remains under investigation by federal authorities.\x94
Breitbart responded to the spokesman with additional questions to which the official replied, \x93We stand by our statement as the most accurate to reflect the situation.\x94

The CBP statement makes no mention of the lost migrant family.
Union said they spoke with the agent again and she confirmed the facts as laid out by the union. She reportedly added that she was not shoved to the ground, but was restrained by the first attacker until the second knocked them off balance. She then extricated herself from the altercation and drew her service weapon. The altercation ended at that point and the two escaped suspects fled the quarter-mile back into Mexico.
The union and CBP both stated the agent was not injured and the incident is being investigated by federal authorities.
Union officials told Breitbart Texas that the agent faced a difficult decision while transporting the three suspects \x97 whether to stop and render aid to the distressed migrant family.
\x93Defending the Constitution of the United States only holds value if we as Federal Agents are defending and protecting those for whom the Constitution exists,\x94 union officials wrote in the Facebook post. \x93We do this by arresting those who need to be arrested and helping those who need to be helped. Often these two duties may come in conflict with one another, as in this particular case, and it should be the primary goal of all who are in the Border Patrol\x92s positions of authority to support Agents when they are forced to make tough decisions in tough situations.\x94
Union officials stated the matter is being investigated by the FBI and the U.S. Attorney\x92s Office as an assault against a federal agent.

b'A U.S. government program is using more than\xa0$15 million in taxpayer money to send hundreds of foreign students to community college. Upon completion of the program, the students will \x93return home with new skills and expertise to help them contribute to the economic growth and development of their country.\x94
While America\x92s national student loan debt is growing, the State Department\x92s Bureau of\xa0Educational and Cultural Affairs is using taxpayer money to fund community college for about 390 foreign students, according to a \x93waste report\x94 released last month by Senator Rand Paul (R-KY).


\x93The State Department is using your taxes to pay the tuition of international students enrolled in American community colleges,\x94 reads the report.
The report adds that, according to the\xa0State Department, an exchange program known as Community College Initiative (CCI) \x93provides scholarships [to students from other countries] to spend up to one academic year at U.S[.] community colleges.\x94
The CCI program has reportedly been given $15,825,000\xa0of taxpayer money to go toward community college costs for foreign students in the 2019 fiscal year. The report adds that the money spent on foreigners is enough to \x93cover a full year of in-state tuition for more than 3,200 U.S. community college students.\x94

\x93The initiative will cover the costs of \x91approximately 130 program participants from approximately 12 countries, to include Brazil, India, Indonesia, South Africa and other countries (subject to change),\x92 according to the funding announcement, each academic year,\x94 reads the report.
The report continues:
While the\xa0State Department hasn\x92t nailed down the countries of origin yet (and leaves itself room to make other adjustments along the way), they have so far determined that the lucky students will get to enroll in one of the following areas: agriculture, applied engineering, business management and administration, early childhood education, information technology, media, public safety, or tourism and hospitality management. For some reason, this list excludes several disciplines that would be valuable in many\xa0other parts of the world, such as nursing and vocational skills.
\x93After completing the program, participants return home with new skills and expertise to help them contribute to the economic growth and development of their country,\x94 notes CCI on a State Department\xa0website.
According to the senator\x92s report, students are supposed to earn\xa0a certificate or similar credential \x93whenever possible\x94 once completing the program, but that it is unclear what they will earn \x93when not possible,\x94 given that \x93the\xa0CCI Program lasts no more than half the time it takes to complete an associate degree.\x94
\x93Since this program is so out of step with the Trump administration\x92s agenda, one might have expected it to have been ended by now,\x94 the report affirms.
You can follow Alana Mastrangelo on Twitter at @ARmastrangelo, and on Instagram.'
