b'President Donald Trump is marking National Religious Freedom Day with a ceremony at the White House on Thursday and is also issuing a guidance letter to educational institutions and the public on students\x92 Constitutional right to prayer.
The guidance will be\xa0posted in the Federal Register on January 21, 2020 and it states, in part:


Section 8524(a) of the Elementary and Secondary Education\xa0Act of 1965 (ESEA), as amended by the Every Student Succeeds Act\xa0and codified at 20 U.S.C. 7904(a), requires the Secretary to\xa0issue guidance to State educational agencies (SEAs), local\xa0educational agencies (LEAs), and the public on constitutionally\xa0protected prayer in public elementary and secondary schools. In\xa0addition, section 8524(b) requires that, as a condition of\xa0receiving ESEA funds, an LEA must certify in writing to its SEA\xa0that it has no policy that prevents, or otherwise denies\xa0participation in, constitutionally protected prayer in public\xa0schools as detailed in this updated guidance.
Education Week\x92s report on the guidance\xa0noted precedent for the Trump administration\x92s move:

The Elementary and Secondary Education Act, in its current and past versions, requires the U.S. Department of Education to provide guidance on prayer in schools every two years, but that guidance hasn\x92t been updated since 2003, a senior administration official said.
\x93President Trump is committed to making sure that people of faith, particularly children,\x94 are not discouraged from constitutionally protected rights to pray, an administration\xa0official said\xa0in a conference call with reporters.
The new school prayer guidance, which will be published in the Federal Register Thursday Jan. 21, reiterates requirements under existing law that school districts must annually certify to their state departments of education that they have \x93no policy prohibiting participation in constitutionally protected prayer,\x94 officials said. State education departments must have a process for fielding complaints the right to prayer has been violated, and they must report any complaints or lawsuits over school prayer to the federal Education Department, the guidance says.
The guidance also states that student religious groups should have the same access to school facilities as secular groups, which has been in place since 1998, Education Week reports.
The Trump administration will also issue a directive on Thursday that states religiously affiliated groups can get federal grants even if the group is located in a state that prohibits public funding of such groups.
\x93Those laws, known as Blaine amendments, are the subject of a case on tax-credit scholarships for private schools that will be heard by the U.S. Supreme Court next week,\x94 Education Week notes in its report.

b'The executives in charge of the James Bond franchise have conceded that James Bond \x93is male\x94 and that they are \x93not particularly interested in taking a male character and having a woman play it.\x94
The duo in charge of Bond are Barbara Broccoli and her half-brother Michael G. Wilson. Both received the franchise from their father, the legendary Albert \x93Cubby\x94 Broccoli. He originated the Bond series, starting with Dr. No in 1962, and saw it though to his death in 1996 at age 87.


Barbara and Wilson are not just trust fund kids. Through her father\x92s Eon Productions, Barbara started out as an assistant director on 1983\x92s Octopussy, worked her way to associate producer, and then a full-fledged producer, starting with Goldeneye in 1995.
Wilson\x92s history reaches back to an executive producer for 1979\x92s Moonraker. He\x92s also a credited screenwriter on five Bond films, including two of the best: For Your Eyes Only (1981) and License to Kill (1989).
For all our complaints about the franchise, both deserve credit for keeping a near 60-year-old property, not just alive, but very profitable. No one\x92s ever come close to accomplishing that and the duo have also bucked the trend of the children of founders failing to live up to the old man.

The good news today is that after flirting with the idea of casting a woman as Bond, Broccoli and Wilson have stepped back from the brink of woke and announced the obvious: James Bond is a guy.
Via Variety:
There are certain things the duo appears open to considering, and other conversations that are nonstarters, when it comes to selecting the next Bond. \x93He can be of any color, but he is male,\x94 says Broccoli. \x93I believe we should be creating new characters for women \x97 strong female characters. I\x92m not particularly interested in taking a male character and having a woman play it. I think women are far more interesting than that.\x94
This was crucial for them to say out loud for a couple of reasons\x85
1) There\x92s a rumor 007 will be a woman in the upcoming No Time to Kill (April), which is a terrible idea, a betrayal, and yet another patronizing and spell-breaking act of Woke Affirmative Action.
2) The overrated Daniel Craig\x92s time is up. After five films, including two of the worst in the franchise: (Spectre and Quantum of Suck), the 51-year-old is hanging up his license to kill. So it\x92s time to find a new Bond, and the idea Bond\x92s gender (and by extension his essence) could be switched is not only preposterous, it would doom the franchise.
My guess is that after watching the hilarious demise of other gender-swapping franchises (Ghostbusters, Men in Black, Terminator, etc.) they realized just how awful of an idea this is.
Bond is a man. Bond is heterosexual. Bond is masculine. Bond is English. Period.
As far as race, as I\x92ve always said, Idris Elba would make a fantastic James Bond. As long as all the above criteria are met, I don\x92t care if Bond is purple.
\xa0

b'Rapper Jay-Z is suing two Mississippi prisons on behalf of 29 prisoners who claim that prison conditions are dangerous and expose them to the type of constant violence that has already killed five prisoners.

The filing insists that the deaths of the five prisoners are a result of years of neglect by authorities and severe understaffing of prison staff.
NBC News recently reported that the state prisons department had been steadily reducing staff.

\x93As Mississippi has incarcerated increasing numbers of people,\x94 NBC reported, \x93it has dramatically reduced its funding of prisons. As a result, prison conditions fail to meet even the most basic human rights.\x94

b'A mother grieving the loss of her daughter and grandchild recently received an unexpected gift from a stranger in Decatur, Illinois.

\x93She went to be with our Lord on Saturday, September 2, 2017. She was engaged to the love of her life, Jeffrey \x91Jeffy\x92 Kessinger. She was his angel and the love of his life,\x94 Astramsky\x92s obituary read.

Tuesday, family members gathered around as the beautiful headstone was installed on the plot.
\x93Now she has a place, she has a true place that\x92s marked for her and the baby,\x94 Crowe said, adding, \x93It\x92s an amazing, wonderful (and) beautiful gift.\x94
The family contacted the local news station to hopefully get a message to the anonymous donor and said they now have closure because of what that person did for them and their two loved ones.

b'A suspect reportedly told police he mixed his mother\x92s ashes in with drugs he used last week in Waukesha, Wisconsin.

Once an informant bought marijuana from the suspects on two separate occasions, police went to the dwelling and searched it.
\x93Investigators said they found 70 grams of marijuana, a small amount of MDMA, bongs and a drug scale,\x94 the criminal complaint stated.
When police found a \x93large amount of unknown powder and vegetable material\x94 inside the apartment, Schroeder told the officers that he had \x93mixed these substances for a variety of reasons.\x94

He also said his mother died a year ago and claimed he mixed a portion of her ashes in with some of the drugs, \x93which he ultimately ingested,\x94 the complaint read.
However, Schroeder did not tell authorities why he admitted to allegedly ingesting the cremated remains he said were in the drugs.
Both suspects face felony drug charges and were released on a signature bond following their arrest. They are expected to appear in Waukesha County Court January 28.
Now that recreational marijuana is legal in Michigan and Illinois, Wisconsin law enforcement officers are worried that residents will take advantage of the neighboring states\x92 laws, according to the Wisconsin State Journal.
\x93The other concern is those people will go down to Illinois and consume marijuana, not bring it back, but will come back under the influence of that controlled substance \x85 that\x92s going to be an issue with regard to highway safety,\x94 said\xa0Rock County Sheriff Troy Knudson.
The sheriff also noted that it could mean an increase in law enforcement official\x92s workload and court cases.
\x93I think we do have to wait until the first of the year to see what the full extent of that will be,\x94 he concluded.'

b'Former Drexel University Professor Chikaodinaka Nwankpa was arrested this week on charges that he illegally spent $96,000 from a federal research grant at strip clubs. The charges at strip clubs are about half of the $185,000 in total that Nwankpa is alleged to have misused.

b'An Oklahoma high school teacher was arrested for allegedly having a threesome with a student and another woman inside her home.

Authorities issued a warrant for Churchwell\x92s arrest, prompting Churchwell to turn herself in. Churchwell was charged with one count of first-degree rape, WHDH reported.
Authorities say there may be more victims and believe that Churchwell messaged another student who did not comply with the investigation.

b'WICHITA, Kan. (AP) \x97 A Kansas associate professor concealed work he was doing for China while employed at the University of Kansas and tried to recruit other researchers and students for the Chinese government, according to revised federal charges filed Wednesday.
An extensively detailed superseding indictment charges Feng \x93Franklin\x94 Tao, 47, of Lawrence, Kansas, with two counts of wire fraud and one count of program fraud for failing to disclose on conflict-of-interest forms the work he was doing for China while employed as a full-time associate professor at the University of Kansas\x92 Center for Environmental Beneficial Catalysis. Prosecutors said some of the Tao\x92s research at the Kansas university was funded by the U.S. Department of Energy.


Tao\x92s defense attorney did not immediately return an after-hours phone message and email seeking comment.
The 16-page indictment describes how China spurred its rapid economic growth by offering scholarships or funding to foreign students or visiting professors who were studying or working at U.S. universities. It also used \x93talent plans\x94 designed to encourage the transfer of original ideas and intellectual property from U.S. universities to Chinese government institutions to enhance Chinese \x93scientific development, economic prosperity, and national security.\x94
Such talent plans have existed since early 1990s, but the Chinese government re-emphasized them in 2007 as part of its strategy to enhance economic development, federal prosecutors said. The Communist Party of China reviews all talent plan applicants, and the government administers and funds the program using other agencies within the Chinese government.

As of 2016, China had recruited more than 56,000 talent program participants. The indictment said the Changjiang Professorship was one such program sponsored by the Chinese government and the Communist Party. It alleges Tao did not disclose to the University of Kansas his selection for the Changjiang Professorship or the salary for his appointment to Fuzhou University in Fuzhou, China.
The Changjiang contract also required Tao to recruit two to three doctor students and three to four master\x92s students per year to work with him at Fuzhou University, according to the indictment.
Federal prosecutors also cited in the indictment email exchanges dealing with Tao\x92s efforts to recruit students and researchers for work in China, and the indictment alleges Tao sponsored at least four researchers and students visiting the University of Kansas from China. At least one of his researchers joined Tao\x92s research team at Fuzhou University, according to the indictment.
Federal prosecutors detailed in the indictment numerous trips Tao took in 2017 and 2018 to China. He also performed \x93some duties\x94 at Nagoya University in Japan.
The unusually detailed superseding indictment came on the heels of a defense motion seeking to dismiss the original indictment against Tao after his attorneys claimed a visiting graduate student fabricated the allegations against him. The judge said during a hearing on that request that a new motion could make some issues raised by the defense moot.
Prior to his arrest in August 2019, Tao was prominently listed as a member of the Fuzhou University on its website, according to the indictment. Shortly after his arrest, all mention of him was deleted from the Fuzhou website. Prosecutors said Tao never requested permission from the University of Kansas to work at Fuzhou University or Nagoya University.
Tau, an associate professor of engineering at the University of Kansas, was born in China and moved to the United States in 2002. He has been employed since August 2014 at the Kansas university\x92s Center for Environmentally Beneficial Catalysis in Lawrence. The center conducts research on sustainable technology to conserve natural resources and energy.'

b'The Democratic candidates for president all call for working more closely with allies on pressuring China to give up its unfair trade practices.
That now looks increasingly impractical.


German Chancellor Angela Merkel indicated this week that her country will not join the U.S. in its efforts to pressure China. In an interview with the Financial Times, Merkel accused the U.S. of criticizing China\x92s practices as \x93regarding China as a threat simply because it is economically successful.\x94

From the Financial Times:
\x93As was the case in Germany, [China\x92s] rise is largely based on hard work, creativity and technical skills,\x94 she says. Of course there is a need to \x93ensure that trade relations are fair\x94. China\x92s economic strength and geopolitical ambitions mean it is a rival to the US and Europe. But the question is: \x93Do we in Germany and Europe want to dismantle all interconnected global supply chains...because of this economic competition?\x94 She adds: \x93In my opinion, complete isolation from China cannot be the answer.\x94
In other words, Merkel dismisses the notion China\x92s predatory mercantilism played a significant role in its economic growth.
This undercuts President Donald Trump\x92s rivals\x92 favorite lines of attack.
\x93We\x92re in a position where, if we don\x92t set the rules, we, in fact, are going to find ourselves with China setting the rules,\x94 Joe Biden said at a Democratic debate in September. \x93And that\x92s why you need to organize the world to take on China, to stop the corrupt practices that are underway.\x94
That\x92s hard to do when one of the largest U.S. allies takes the position that Merkel has now articulated.'

b'The Senate\xa0overwhelmingly approved the\xa0United States\x96Mexico\x96Canada Agreement on Thursday, delivering President Donald Trump a major legislative victory in a presidential election year.
Lawmakers voted 89 to 10 to pass the legislation ratifying the agreement, sending it the White House for the president\x92s signature. The development comes one day after China agreed to purchase an additional $200 billion in U.S. goods and services over the next two years as part of their \x93phase one\x94 trade agreement.


\x93Today the Senate will send this landmark agreement to the president\x92s desk,\x94 Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said in a statement prior to the upper chamber\x92s vote. \x93Quite a week of substantive accomplishments for the nation, for the president, and for international trade.\x94

The House\xa0approved\xa0the agreement 358-41 on December 19th, following more than a year of talks between White House officials and congressional leaders.
The\xa0USMCA\xa0maintains much of the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA), but will usher in new trade considerations, such as 75 percent of vehicle parts must be made in the three countries to be tariff-free. Additionally, 45 percent of car parts must be made by workers earning a $16 hourly wage.\xa0Further, the deal will expand U.S. farmers\x92 access to Canada\x92s dairy market.
President\xa0Donald Trump signed the deal with Canadian Prime Minister\xa0Justin Trudeau\xa0and then-Mexican President\xa0Enrique Pe\xf1a Nieto in November of last year. At the time, the president called it the \x93largest, most significant, modern and balanced trade agreement in history.\x94
U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer lauded the agreement\x92s signage, saying it is expected to create up to\xa0589,000 American jobs and spur additional economic growth.
\x93House passage of the USMCA with such huge bipartisan support is a major milestone and shows just how much President Trump is successfully changing U.S. trade policy so it works for the benefit of American workers, farmers, ranchers, and businesses,\x94 said Lighthizer. \x93The USMCA is expected to create between 176,000 and 589,000 new American jobs and substantially increase economic growth.\xa0 The International Trade Commission\x92s analysis shows that USMCA will have a more positive impact on our economy, jobs, and wages than any other U.S. trade agreement ever negotiated.\x94'

b'The phase one trade deal signed in the White House this week is a historic break-through for the Trump administration, establishing enforceable commitments by China for the first time.
It should be looked at as a test for China, John Carney told Breitbart News editor-in-chief Alex Marlow on Breitbart News Daily Thursday. If China lives up to its commitments under the deal, including protecting American intellectual property and ending forced technology transfers, it will demonstrate that President Donald Trump\x92s policies have forced China to abandon at least some of its predatory mercantilist strategies.


If China fails, the U.S. can unilaterally impose tariffs and China is prohibited from retaliating with its own tariffs, Carney explained. If China continues to resist reforms that would make it a safe trading partner, the U.S. will have to move away from trade with China.
Another important achievement is that the U.S. got to keep nearly all of its existing tariffs in place, Carney explained.
The deal also should open China\x92s markets to U.S. beef, dairy, and poultry, long a source of frustration for U.S. farmers excluded by non-tariff barriers.

The deal also requires China to change the way claims of intellectual property theft are handled in China, a significant legal reform that should discourage Chinese companies from stealing I.P. and trade secrets.
China\x92s willingness and ability to abide by its commitments is still the big unknown, Carney said. But the trade deal sets up a \x93trust but verify\x94 regime. If China fails the test, the U.S. would be justified in decoupling its economy from China\x92s, Carney said.
\x93China has agreed to stop a bunch of abusive practices and agreed that we can respond to tariffs, and they will not retaliate. That\x92s something that has never been done before,\x94 Carney said. \x93If China will not live up to this agreement, then there will be no phase two.\x94

Breitbart News Daily\xa0airs on SiriusXM Patriot Channel 125, weekdays 6 a.m. to 9 a.m. Eastern.'

b'Dr. Michael Baden,\xa0a former New York City medical examiner, alleged Thursday that autopsy photos of\xa0Jeffrey Epstein show he had burst capillaries in his eyes, which is a more common occurrence with strangulation than with hanging.

b'Sen. Rand Paul (R-KY) is threatening to force the Senate to vote on subpoenaing Hunter Biden and the \x93whistleblower\x94 in the event that his Republican colleagues side with Democrats and their demand for more impeachment witnesses \x97 a move that would put some of them in vulnerable positions from a reelection standpoint.
While House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) ultimately moved to transmit the articles of impeachment against President Trump to the Senate without her party\x92s demand for the promise of pre-trial witnesses, the debate is far from over. Sens. Susan Collins\x92 (R-ME) and Lisa Murkowski\x92s (R-AK) respective calls for the Senate trial to proceed in the mold of former President Bill Clinton\x92s trial solidified Majority Leader Mitch McConnell\x92s (R-KY) upper hand. However, both have signaled that they are open to calling forth witnesses after hearing opening statements.


Paul has a contingency plan. According to Politico, Paul \x93will make the Senate vote on subpoenaing the president\x92s preferred witnesses, including Hunter Biden and the \x93whistleblower\x94 who revealed the Ukraine scandal\x94 in the event that four or more of his GOP colleagues side with Democrats and call for additional witnesses, putting at-risk GOP incumbents in more vulnerable positions.
\x93If you vote against Hunter Biden, you\x92re voting to lose your election, basically. Seriously. That\x92s what it is,\x94 Paul said, according to Politico.
\x93If you don\x92t want to vote and you think you\x92re going to have to vote against Hunter Biden, you should just vote against witnesses, period,\x94 he explained.

Paul says he would prefer to have the Senate trial dismissed as soon as possible, without calling witnesses. Nevertheless, if his colleagues concede to the demands of Democrats, Paul is prepared to demand more.
\x93My first preference would be to be done with it as soon as possible and not to have any witnesses,\x94 Paul told the outlet.
\x93If they insist on having people like Bolton coming forward, my insistence will be not just one witness. But that the president should be able to call any witnesses that he deems necessary to his defense,\x94 he added.
Paul\x92s plan follows reports of Collins working with a \x93fairly small group\x94 of GOP senators to build support for impeachment witnesses.
\x93I am hopeful that we can reach an agreement on how to proceed with the trial that will allow the opportunity for both the House and the president\x92s counsel if they choose to do so,\x94 Collins\xa0said at the time, according to\xa0Bangor Daily News.

\x93Both Collins and Murkowski said on Wednesday they aren\x92t advocating for specific witnesses but simply want to retain the right to hear more evidence during the trial,\x94 Politico reported.
\x93If he\x92s saying that both sides should have an opportunity, I agree with that, to call witnesses,\x94 Collins stated. \x93We\x92ll make the call on which ones.\x94
\x93But it isn\x92t fair to just let one side call witnesses,\x94 she said, agreeing with Paul but noting that his threat is \x93not [her] focus.\x94

b'Iranian President Hassan Rouhani bragged Thursday that Iran is now enriching more uranium than it was before President Barack Obama\x92s nuclear deal, formally known as the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA). 
This boast would be a profound embarrassment for supporters of the JCPOA if true since Iran only abrogated the last few provisions of the deal a week ago.


\x93Pressure has increased on Iran, but we continue to progress. We have no limits on the nuclear file, and we are increasing enrichment every day,\x94 Rouhani said in a televised speech.
Rouhani claimed Iran has been patient ever since the \x93unpredictable\x94 President Donald Trump made the \x93mistake\x94 of withdrawing from the JCPOA. He continued Iran\x92s efforts to blackmail Europe by saying he would consider returning to the limits established by the JCPOA if the Europeans \x93make up\x94 for America\x92s exit.
\x93If they fail to do so, we will, in turn, reduce our commitments,\x94 he said.

On Tuesday, France, Germany, and the United Kingdom rejected Iran\x92s claims that it was entitled to resume unlimited uranium enrichment and triggered the JCPOA\x92s dispute mechanism for the first time. This process could ultimately end with the U.N. Security Council voting to reimpose full international sanctions on Iran, adding to the already crushing burden from the U.S. sanctions restored by Trump.
Iranian Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif angrily denounced Europe\x92s invocation of the dispute mechanism as \x93legally baseless and a strategic mistake from a political standpoint.\x94 Rouhani threatened violent attacks on European soldiers, much as Iran and its proxies have been conducting terrorist attacks against Americans, if Europe does not obey Iran\x92s demands.
\x93Today, the American soldier is not safe, tomorrow it could be the turn of the European soldier. You will suffer if you take a wrong move,\x94 Rouhani declared.
On Thursday, Zarif goaded the Europeans as \x93appeasers\x94 and puppets of Trump, who he described as a \x93high school bully\x94 for reportedly using tariff threats to force France, Germany, and the UK to activate the JCPOA dispute mechanism. Some European diplomats grumbled that tariffs were threatened by Washington, but said Iran\x92s behavior made them decide to take action before it was made.
The Associated Press reported that Iran \x93has only modestly increased its nuclear activity\x94 despite Rouhani\x92s belligerent boasts.

\x93In recent months it has boosted its enrichment of uranium to 4.5 percent \x96 higher than the 3.67 percent limit set by the agreement but far from the 20 percent enrichment it was engaged in before the deal. Uranium must be enriched to 90 percent to be used in a nuclear weapon,\x94 the AP wrote, without mentioning that reaching 20 percent enrichment covers roughly 90 percent of the work required to create weapons-grade material.
The head of Iran\x92s nuclear agency stated in November that over a thousand centrifuges at the Fordow nuclear facility were being spun up to enrich uranium at five percent. He also said Iran had a significant stockpile of 20 percent uranium, which can be used in research reactors.
Rouhani said in December that Iran was testing even more advanced uranium centrifuges, in clear violation of the JCPOA. The centrifuges in question would be able to quickly ramp up to weapons-grade uranium production.
Israeli intelligence warned on Wednesday that on its current trajectory, Iran will have enough enriched uranium to produce a nuclear bomb by the end of this year, although it still lacks the missile technology necessary to deliver a nuclear warhead at long range. However, France, Germany, and the UK wrote a letter to the United Nations in December that warned Iran is much closer to producing nuclear-capable missiles than previously believed and has violated U.N. resolutions to achieve that capability.
Radio Farda on Tuesday reported Iran\x92s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) published photos of at least three underground \x93missile cities\x94 where huge stockpiles of missiles are kept in hardened bunkers hundreds of feet below mountains. The IRGC presumably published the photos to emphasize that its missiles cannot be neutralized with preemptive airstrikes.'

b'President Hassan Rouhani echoed Iranian state propaganda Thursday with his claim that American soldiers had \x93retreated\x94 in the Middle East following an Iranian missile attack that caused no American casualties and negligible property damage last week.
The attack resulted in 176 deaths after an Iranian soldier shot a Ukrainian commercial airliner out of the sky shortly after takeoff from Tehran, reportedly mistaking the plane for an American missile. Iran first falsely claimed evidence the plane had spontaneously combusted, then admitted to having shot it down. On Wednesday, officials began floating the theory that America had hacked into their missile systems and shot the plane to embarrass Tehran, offering no evidence.


Iran\x92s PressTV outlet published an article Wednesday, citing a report by Agence France-Presse (AFP) quoting American troops on the group during the Iranian ballistic missile attack, alleging that the Americans were \x93horror-struck\x94 and the targeted Iraqi bases suffered \x93extensive damage,\x94 an allegation both Washington and Baghdad, which administers the bases, denies.
\x93Horror-struck with Iran\x92s attack on their military base in Iraq, American soldiers recount how they lost contact with their state-of-the-art unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) in the sky,\x94 PressTV recounted. \x93At the time the attack was launched, the U.S. army was flying seven UAVs, including MQ-1C Gray Eagles, over Iraq to monitor bases where US-led coalition forces are deployed,\xa0AFP said in a report\xa0on Wednesday.\x94
The report in question did note American forces were flying UAVs at the time of the attack. Omitted from the report is the fact that no human damage occurred as a result of over a dozen ballistic missiles hitting the Ain al-Assad airbase in Iraq.

\x93Most of the other 1,500 US soldiers had been tucked away in bunkers for two hours, after advance warning from superiors,\x94 AFP reported. \x93But 14 pilots had stayed in dark containers-turned-cockpits to remotely fly the \x93birds\x94 and monitor essential feeds from their high-powered cameras.\x94
A supporter of the Basij, a militia loyal to the Islamic republic\x92s establishment, walks over a Union Jack and US flag as he arrives at a memorial for victims of the Ukraine plane crash, in University of Tehran on January 14, 2020.\xa0 (ATTA KENARE/AFP via Getty Images)
AFP spoke to some of these pilots, who stated they at times felt it was possible they could die in a missile strike.
The PressTV report claimed \x93reports of extensive damage\x94 at the base, not citing any in particular. The AFP report did not describe any \x93extensive damage.\x94 PressTV did acknowledge, however, that the U.S. government confirmed \x93only minimal damage was sustained at the base.\x94
Reporting only vague \x93extensive damage\x94 is progress for PressTV, which joined at least three other English-language Iranian outlets last week in claiming that the missiles had killed at least 80 American soldiers. Fars News Agency, another state-run outlet, claimed 200 American soldiers suffered injuries in the attack in addition to the 80 dead. Tasnim, an Iranian propaganda outlet that brands itself independent of the regime, quoted another \x93source\x94 heralding the destructive power of the missiles.

\x93[T]he accuracy and destructive power of the missiles have been so high that a number of the missiles\xa0annihilated several sensitive targets simultaneously each,\x94 the source claimed.
All the outlets cited the same unnamed Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) source for their claim of dead Americans.

The IRGC is a U.S.-designated foreign terrorist organization. Iran\x92s missile strikes were branded retaliation for an American airstrike eliminating Major General Qasem Soleimani, the head of the IRGC\x92s Quds Force. Soleimani led the foreign arm of the IRGC, tasked with helping Iranian proxies in the region and beyond kill American soldiers, suppress civilian action against Iran, and otherwise cling to power.
The Iranian outlets have not corrected or removed their reports of dead and injured Americans from their webpages at press time, despite the Pentagon confirming they are not true.
Rouhani also appeared to applaud the missile strikes as having made an impact in America\x92s role in the Middle East on Thursday.

\x93The United States is oppressing and carrying out acts of aggression against all countries around the world, and some may respond with words, but the Islamic Republic of Iran waged military strike against their base for one night and kept the Pentagon awake for 24 hours,\x94 Rouhani proclaimed. \x93After the U.S. actions, it became clear for themselves and the world that their program was completely wrong. And this is not something to be just inferred, but the U.S. President had told leaders of other countries that the Iranian regime would not resist for more than three months with the new sanctions and maximum pressure.\x94
The head commander of the IRGC, Major General Hossein Salami, similarly declared victory on Wednesday.
\x93In the 41-year-old history of the Iranian nation\x92s battle against its enemies, we have witnessed bright pages of the nation\x92s unique and strategic victories,\x94 Salami reportedly\xa0said. \x93The Iranian nation has\xa0defeated the fundemental policies of the enemy in the region and the world. The great Iran has undermined the US power, and we are seeing the effects of its decay today.\x94
As of Wednesday, reports from Iraq indicate that American troops have returned to their regular activities against the Islamic State, contradicting Iranian declarations of retreat.

b'China\x92s Taiwan Affairs Office claimed that \x93increasing voices\x94 within Communist Party territory support \x93reunification through military force\x94 with Taiwan to combat \x93secessionists.\x94
Taiwan is a sovereign island state off the coast of China. It has never been governed by the People\x92s Republic of China, so the Chinese use of the terms \x93reunification\x94 and \x93secession\x94 are misnomers.


Addressing a press conference on Wednesday, spokesperson for Taiwan Affairs Office of the State Council\xa0Ma Xiaoguang warned Taiwan to \x93introspect upon where they want to lead cross-Straits relations\x94 in the coming months and years following the re-election of anti-communist President Tsai Ing-wen.
In a thinly veiled threat, Ma cited the \x93increasing voices\x94 within China expecting Beijing to step up its efforts to protect the \x93one China principle\x94 through a process of \x93reunification through military force.\x94 The \x93One China principle\x94 is Beijing\x92s assertion that Taiwan is a province of China. The \x93One China Policy,\x94 which Taiwan adheres to, is that there is only one China in the world. Taipei considers the Republic of China, Taiwan\x92s official name, its \x93One China.\x94
\x93This sentiment is a result provoked by the actions of the DPP authority and Taiwan secessionists that went against the trend of the times,\x94 Ma explained. \x93Upholding the\xa01992 Consensus which reflects the adherence to the one-China principle is the unshakeable foundation for the peaceful development of cross-Straits relations.\x94

\x93Taiwan secessionist forces and their actions are the biggest threat to the peace across the Straits, and must be contained,\x94 he continued.
This week, China\x92s\xa0state-run English language propaganda outlet Global Times\xa0urged Beijing to start to \x93impose military pressure\x94 against Taiwan, which they described as an \x93unbearable option\x94 for the Taiwanese government.
\x93It is absolutely the will of the 1.4 billion Chinese people that Taiwan secession must be prevented no matter what action needs to be taken,\x94\xa0Times\xa0Editor-in-Chief\xa0Hu Xijin said in a video directed at Chinese Communist Party (CCP) officials.
Hu also urged the Trump administration against siding with a Taiwanese attempt at succession, declaring that Washington \x93cannot just consider public opinion in Taiwanese society while disregarding public opinion on the mainland.\x94
\x93If Tsai supports the Tsai administration in making a new provocative move, it will have to bear the consequences,\x94 he warned.\xa0Although Hu\x92s remarks are not officially representative of the communist state, his warning is intended to show the hawkish elements within the CCP who are already gearing up for military action.
President Tsai appeared unfazed by the threats in an interview with the BBC on Tuesday, urging China to face the reality that Taiwan was \x93an independent country already\x94 and deserved more respect from Beijing.

\x93We don\x92t have a need to declare ourselves an independent state. We are an independent country already and we call ourselves the Republic of China, Taiwan,\x94 she said. \x93Invading Taiwan is something that is going to be very costly for China. We\x92re a successful democracy, we have a pretty decent economy, [and] we deserve respect from China.\x94
Follow Ben Kew on\xa0Facebook, on Twitter at\xa0@ben_kew,\xa0or\xa0email him at bkew@breitbart.com.'

b'The White House signaled Wednesday the impeachment trial of President Donald Trump would not last longer than two weeks, suggesting the Senate would move quickly to try the case.
\x93I think it\x92s extraordinarily unlikely that we\x92d be going beyond two weeks,\x94 a senior White House official told reporters in a phone briefing. \x93We think that this case is overwhelming for the president, and the Senate is not going to have any need to be taking that amount of time on this.\x94


President Trump has already accepted House Speaker Nancy Pelosi\x92s invitation to deliver a State of the Union address on February 4, 2020. The Senate impeachment trial is expected to begin on January 21.
The White House criticized House Democrats for delaying the transfer of articles to the Senate, despite expressing urgency during the impeachment process and saying the trial should move quickly.
\x93These are the weakest articles of impeachment that have ever been passed in any presidential impeachment,\x94 the official stated. \x93They state no violation of a crime, no violation of any law.\x94

The official also defended the idea of the right to dismiss the impeachment case outright, a proposal that Senate Republicans have not supported.
\x93Why would there be a motion to dismiss?\x94 he asked. \x93That\x92s because these articles of impeachment are so weak that, on their face, if this were a court proceeding, they\x92d be subject to dismissal.\x94
The White House left open the possibility of the Senate opening the trial to further witnesses, but said if Democrats were allowed to call new witnesses to the case, Republicans and the president would call additional witnesses as well.
\x93We\x92re prepared for all possibilities,\x94 the official said.
The official ridiculed the idea of Democrats demanding further witnesses, arguing the Senate trial should not be a \x93do-over\x94 for House Democrats.
\x93They\x92re supposed to do their preparation and come ready to present a case,\x94 he said. \x93If they\x92re not able to do that, then what should happen is, the president should be acquitted.\x94'

b'On Wednesday\x92s broadcast of CNN\x92s \x93AC360,\x94 Sen. Jeff Merkley (D-OR) stated that in the Senate\x92s impeachment trial, \x93the president\x92s lawyers deserve to pull in whoever they feel contributes to their case,\x94 and that senators \x93should not be determining who is relevant to the case.\x94
Merkley said the Senate trial \x93is really a situation where the president\x92s lawyers deserve to pull in whoever they feel contributes to their case, and the House managers in presenting their case need to be able to pull in and have a subpoena for the witnesses and for the documents. That\x92s what a trial is, full fairness to present the case on both sides.\x94


He added, \x93My belief is that the jurors, the hundred of us, should not be determining who is relevant to the case. And, quite frankly, I think that if either side tries to turn this into a circus, pulling in people who are clearly not relevant, or continuing the persecution of a political opponent, it would do great harm to that side. So, I would say that, in this case, the right of the defense to choose who they think is relevant and present that information is something no one else should be able to interfere with.\x94
Follow Ian\xa0Hanchett on Twitter\xa0@IanHanchett'

b'Thursday on Fox News Channel, Sen. Marsha Blackburn (R-TN) commented on the impeachment trial in the Senate.
After much hullabaloo was made in the Democrat-majority House over impeachment, Blackburn said it is not the Senate\x92s job to \x93expand\x94 the impeachment. Instead, she told \x93Fox & Friends\x94 that it is the Senate\x92s job to \x93review\x94 impeachment in a fair and expedient manner.


\x93[I]mpeachment is a noun,\x94 explained Blackburn. \x93The impeaching process took place in the House. If they wanted to call these witnesses, they could have called them. It is not our job to expand the impeachment. It is our job to review what they have sent forward, and that\x92s exactly what we\x92re going to do.\x94

She added, \x93We\x92re going to do it in an expedient manner, we\x92re going to be fair to the president and to the process, and we\x92re going to get this behind us.\x94

b'Audio giant Bose is reportedly closing all of its retail stores in America and Canada, along with Europe, Japan, and Australia in a move towards an entirely digital sales plan. The company will keep about half of its global locations open, concentrating on China, India, and several other asian markets.
The Verge reports\xa0that speaker and headphones manufacturer Bose has announced plans to close its entire retail store footprint in North America, Europe, Japan, and Australia. The company stated that the vast majority of its speakers and headphones\xa0\x93are increasingly purchased through e-commerce\x94 as its reasoning for closing the stores.


Bose opened its first physical store in 1993 and has many locations throughout shopping centers and malls across the United States. The company showcases its product lineup in these stores which ranges from noise-canceling headphones to smart speakers and bone conductive sunglasses that quietly play music to the wearer.

Colette Burke, Bose\x92s vice president of global sales, commented on the company\x92s decision stating:\xa0\x93Originally, our retail stores gave people a way to experience, test, and talk to us about multi-component, CD and DVD-based home entertainment systems. At the time, it was a radical idea, but we focused on what our customers needed, and where they needed it \x97 and we\x92re doing the same thing now.\x94
The company will be shutting down a total of 119 stores in the coming months. It told the Verge via email:\xa0\x93In other parts of the world, Bose stores will remain open, including approximately 130 stores located in Greater China and the United Arab Emirates; and additional stores in India, Southeast Asia, and South Korea.\x94
The company\x92s full statement on the situation reads:
Given the dramatic shift to online shopping in specific markets, Bose plans to close its remaining 119 retail stores across North America, Europe, Japan and Australia over the next several months. In other parts of the world, Bose stores will remain open, including approximately 130 stores located in Greater China and the United Arab Emirates; and additional stores in India, Southeast Asia, and South Korea.
In 1993, Bose opened its first store in the United States to provide personal, private demonstrations for Wave music systems and Lifestyle home theater systems. As smartphones changed the industry, the company\x92s focus turned to mobile, Bluetooth, and Wi-Fi solutions. Today, Bose noise-cancelling headphones, truly wireless sport earbuds, portable speakers, and smart speakers are increasingly purchased through e-commerce, including Bose.com; and Bose is a larger multi-national company, with a localized mix of channels tailored for a country or region.
\x93Originally, our retail stores gave people a way to experience, test, and talk to us about multi-component, CD and DVD-based home entertainment systems,\x94 said Colette Burke, vice president of Global Sales, Bose Corporation. \x93At the time, it was a radical idea, but we focused on what our customers needed, and where they needed it \x96 and we\x92re doing the same thing now. It\x92s still difficult, because the decision impacts some of our amazing store teams who make us proud every day. They take care of every person who walks through our doors \x96 whether that\x92s helping with a problem, giving expert advice, or just letting someone take a break and listen to great music. Over the years, they\x92ve set the standard for customer service. And everyone at Bose is grateful.\x94
Bose will be offering outplacement assistance and severance to affected employees. Additional details, including the number of employees affected, will remain private.
Bose products are still being sold on the company\x92s official site and many third-party retailers.
Lucas Nolan is a reporter for Breitbart News covering issues of free speech and online censorship. Follow him on Twitter\xa0@LucasNolan\xa0or email him at\xa0lnolan@breitbart.com'

b'Retail sales rose at a healthy pace in December, a sign that a very healthy U.S. labor market and consumer optimism is continuing to support economic growth.
The Commerce Department said Thursday that retail sales\x96which measures sales at stores, online, and in restaurants\x96increased a seasonally adjusted three-tenths of a percentage point in December compared with November to $529.6 billion. That was in line with the consensus forecast.


Excluding the volatile autos category, sales rose seven-tenths of a percentage point. That was much stronger than expected. Excluding autos and gas, retail sales rose five-tenths of a percentage point, the strongest gain in five months.

Auto sales fell 1.3 percent compared with November but were 4.1 percent compared with December of 2018.
On an annual basis, sales were up 5.9 percent. Almost every category showed strong gains. The exceptions were department stores, down 5.5 percent, and electronics and appliance stores, down seven-tenths of a percentage point. Online sales were up 19.2 percent. Sales at restaurants and bars were up 4.9 percent.'

b'The number of Americans filing initial claims for unemployment benefits fell sharply last week.
Jobless claims fell 10,000 to a seasonally adjusted 204,000 for the week ended January 10. Economists had expected a small rise from 214,000 to 215,000.


The four-week moving average, which smooths out week-to-week volatility and is considered by many to be a more reliable indicator of economic conditions, fell to 216,250, a decrease of 7,750 from the previous week.
Because jobless claims are a proxy for layoffs, they have been closely watched for signs that economic conditions are weakening the labor market. The low levels of claims, as well as very low unemployment, indicates that U.S. businesses are reluctant to let workers go. The tight labor market is likely to continue to support consumer spending, a crucial element of economic growth.'

b'The U.S. manufacturing sector appears to be regaining its footing, suggesting the beaten-down sector may once again be expanding.
The Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia\x92s survey-based index of manufacturing activity soared to 17 in January, up from the weak 0.3 reading in December and well-above forecasts for a reading of 3.0.


That followed a better than expected reading from the New York Fed\x92s Empire State index, which rose to 4.8 from 3.5. Economists had forecast it remaining close to unchanged.

Taken together, the surveys suggest that manufacturing may be recovering from the doldrums that set in this summer.
The gauges tracking capital expenditures, hiring, and new orders all improved from the prior month. The expectations for the future hit the highest level since 2018.
\x93Over 62 percent of the firms anticipate increasing production in the first quarter,\x94 the Philly Fed said. \x93Among the firms expecting an increase in production, 25 percent indicated that this would be accomplished with additional workers. But most indicated higher production would be accomplished without additional hiring: Thirty-three percent would increase the hours of existing workers, while 36 percent indicated production could be increased with higher productivity of existing workers.\x94'

b'The French Catholic bishops have approved the removal of references to the sex of parents on children\x92s baptismal registry forms.
In February 2019, Bishop Joseph de Metz-Noblat of Langres, president of the French bishops\x92 conference Council for Canonical Questions, wrote to the bishops that changes in baptismal documents should be made in order to avoid charges of \x93discrimination,\x94 reported Catholic News Agency (CNA).


According to the report, Father Claude Barthe, editor of Catholic Res Novae, observed that de Metz-Noblat has participated in the process of reworking the baptismal forms since 2013, when same-sex marriage and child adoption were legalized in France.
\x93The increasingly complex situation of families in France makes it extremely difficult to draft Catholic acts, especially regarding baptism,\x94 de Metz-Noblat wrote in December 2018, adding concerns about \x93problems of vocabulary.\x94
The bishop said, according to canon law, \x93ministers cannot refuse sacraments to persons who opportunely ask for them, while children cannot be held responsible for the situation of their parents.\x94

CNA continued in its report:
As a result, Bishop de Metz-Noblat said he had worked with two other commissions to produce a new baptismal registry formula that will require \x93names and first names of parents or other holders of parental authority,\x94 which he wrote would make \x93the simple acknowledgment of one\x92s family situation, without bearing moral judgment on it.\x94
The change had now been approved by the bishops\x92 permanent council, Bishop de Metz-Noblat added.
However, CNA noted that Father Pius Pietrzyk, a Dominican priest who is chair of the pastoral studies department at St. Patrick\x92s Seminary in Menlo Park, California, said recommendations from a bishops\x92 conference are not binding law.
The bishops\x92 conference, he said, is \x93simply a pastoral engine for the bishops of a certain area to coordinate their pastoral ministry.\x94
CNA also cited a letter by Cardinal Francesco Coccopalmerio who, in 2017, was serving as prefect of the Pontifical Council for Legislative Texts and provided the views of the Holy See on the issue of baptisms of children of same-sex couples.
\x93[T]here is not a specific law with respect to the entry of same sex couples or \x91transgendered persons\x92 as parents on the baptismal record,\x94 the cardinal reportedly explained. \x93The term \x91parents\x92 used by the Church\x92s Canon 877 clearly refers to the father and mother, the man and the woman created by God who are united in the sacrament of marriage.\x94

Coccopalmerio also wrote:
The entry of same sex couples or \x93transgendered persons\x94\xa0as parents would be contrary to the aforementioned canon and the teaching of Our Lord and of the Church on marriage as God desires it as the union between a man and a woman. If one of the partners is the natural father or mother of the child, it must be mentioned on the record, the other partner cannot be entered.
\x93Given the foregoing instructions, we do not consider it possible to enter on the baptismal record two mothers or two fathers or a \x91transgendered father\x92 whose real nature is a woman or a \x91transgendered mother\x92 whose true nature is a man,\x94 the cardinal concluded.
According to Barthe, a number of French dioceses will likely ignore the bishops\x92 conference recommendation to remove references to the parents\x92 sex on baptismal documents as each bishop has authority over his diocese.
The Catholic Herald reported some of the criticism of the new recommendation.
\x93It\x92s strange the Church is being advised to adapt to state laws this way\xa0\x96 I see no need for it,\x94 said Antoine Renard, honorary president of the Federation of Catholic Family Associations. \x93The Church teaches families are created by fathers and mothers, and that other forms are not families. Lesbian and other couples could demand otherwise, but this won\x92t be accepted by the Church.\x94
In an interview with Catholic News Service, Renard also said that while the church could not \x93refuse baptisms,\x94 it could require parents seeking the sacrament for their child to commit to \x93raise children according to church rules.\x94'

In its World Watch List 2020, Open Doors notes that one in 8 believers around the world suffers serious levels of persecution, while providing an in-depth look at the 50 countries where it is most dangerous to be a Christian.


In a nutshell, the new report reveals, every day, eight Christians are killed because of their faith and 23 Christians are raped or sexually harassed; every week, 182 Christian churches or buildings are attacked and 102 Christian homes, shops or businesses are attacked, burned, or destroyed; every month, 309 Christians are imprisoned unjustly.
The most acute persecution of Christians occurs in North Korea, the report found, but Afghanistan is close behind in the number two slot.
In the case of North Korea, persecution is driven by a virulent atheistic Communist ideology which views the estimated 200,000 to 400,000 Christians as traitors of the state because their allegiance is to God, not supreme leader Kim Jong Un. North Korean defector Kwak Jeong-ae, 65, shows a drawing about North Korea during an interview in Uijeongbu, South Korea. Experts and defectors say most of North Korea\x92s underground Christians do not engage in the extremely dangerous work of proselytizing. Open Doors has monitored global Christian persecution since 1992 and launched its Watch List in 2002, which has been topped by North Korea every year.
In the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan, on the other hand, Christians are also seen as traitors, but traitors to Islam rather than to an atheist state. According to Afghan law, citizens may not become Christians and conversion is seen as apostasy as well as treason, and converts are often killed by their family, clan, or tribe.
Following North Korea and Afghanistan, the 2020 Watch List is similar to recent years. Somalia ranks number three, followed by Libya (no. four), Pakistan (no. five), Eritrea (no. six), Sudan (no. seven), Yemen (no. eight), Iran (no. nine), and India (no. ten).

b'President Donald J. Trump has officially proclaimed January 16, 2020, \x93Religious Freedom Day\x94 to commemorate \x93the foundational link between freedom and faith in our country.\x94
\x93From its opening pages, the story of America has been rooted in the truth that all men and women are endowed with the right to follow their conscience, worship freely, and live in accordance with their convictions,\x94 reads the proclamation, by which President Trump said he wished to \x93reaffirm our commitment to safeguarding the religious liberty of all Americans.\x94


By official proclamation Wednesday, the president renewed an annual tradition dating to 1993, which commemorates the Virginia Statute for Religious Freedom, authored and championed by Thomas Jefferson, by declaring its anniversary on January 16 \x93Religious Freedom Day.\x94
Religious freedom in America is often referred to as our \x93first freedom,\x94 Trump said, and it was a \x93driving force behind some of the earliest defining moments of our American identity.\x94
\x93The desire for religious freedom impelled the Pilgrims to leave their homes in Europe and journey to a distant land, and it is the reason so many others seeking to live out their faith or change their faith have made America their home,\x94 he said.

In October 2018, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo declared that protection of religious freedom is \x93central to the Trump administration\x92s foreign policy,\x94 as well as being \x93an essential part of who we are as Americans.\x94
\x93Religious freedom appears first among the rights enumerated in our Constitution. Where religious freedom flourishes, there is greater stability and more economic opportunity,\x94 Mr. Pompeo said.
In his proclamation Wednesday, Trump cited Thomas Jefferson, who said that \x93all men shall be free to profess, and by argument to maintain, their opinions in matters of Religion, and that the same shall in no wise diminish, enlarge or affect their civil capacities,\x94 a belief underlying the First Amendment as well as the Constitution\x92s prohibition on a religious test for occupying a federal post.
This principle sought \x93to prevent government interference in religion,\x94 Trump noted.
The president reaffirmed his administration\x92s commitment to protecting religious liberty, insisting he would not tolerate \x93the violation of any American\x92s ability to worship freely and openly and to live as his or her faith commands.\x94

Regarding violations of religious freedom abroad, Trump noted that repressive governments \x93persecute religious worshipers using high-tech surveillance, mass detention, and torture, while terrorist organizations carry out barbaric violence against innocent victims on account of their religion.\x94
The State Department has convened two ministerials to advance religious freedom, he observed, \x93to identify concrete ways to combat religious persecution and discrimination around the world and ensure greater respect for freedom of religion and belief.\x94
\x93Our Founders entrusted the American people with a responsibility to protect religious liberty so that our Nation may stand as a bright beacon for the rest of the world,\x94 the president said. \x93Today, we remain committed to that sacred endeavor and strive to support those around the world who still struggle under oppressive regimes that impose restrictions on freedom of religion.\x94
In proclaiming January 16, 2020, Religious Freedom Day, the president called on all Americans \x93to commemorate this day with events and activities that remind us of our shared heritage of religious liberty and that teach us how to secure this blessing both at home and around the world.\x94

b'China has adopted a new strategy in its war on Christianity, Open Doors reveals, targeting children to stamp out future generations of believers.
New regulations regarding religious practice took effect in China in 2018, Open Doors notes in its 2020 World Watch List, which was released Wednesday.


\x93Christians are increasingly being pushed underground in China,\x94 said David Curry, president of Open Doors. \x93Pastors are being detained, churches are being closed and people who have a personal faith in Jesus are being watched using technology that was never available before.\x94
\x93The Church is being squeezed in China,\x94 he noted.
Yet along with increased monitoring of religious activity and an outright ban on unregistered religious groups, the new norms specifically target children.

The 2018 regulations ban church youth camps, forbid young Christians from sharing their faith with their friends at school, and prohibit anyone under the age of 18 from participating entering a church.
In practice, the 2018 restrictions have instilled fear among Christian students and their parents that attendance at church or youth group, or sharing their faith, could result in the church being fined or negative repercussions for the student, Open Doors found, with Christian students threatened with penalties including obstacles to graduation.
Many Christian parents have begun to discourage their children from attending church activities out of fear of government or school reprisals, Open Doors said, meaning they have no exposure to Christian worship, bible study, or the sacraments.
\x93We know of some school teachers who warn children that if they follow Jesus they may not be allowed to graduate,\x94 said one Chinese church leader on condition of anonymity. \x93This creates a terrible struggle in young people\x92s hearts.\x94
\x93They are torn between living free in the truth of who they really are, versus possible punishment at the hands of their teachers or parents,\x94 he continued. \x93If they admit they follow Jesus, they could lose everything they have worked for.\x94

\x93Counting the cost of following Jesus is not just words here; it is a reality that even new believers have to face,\x94 he said.
As Breitbart News reported in early 2019, one Chinese district forced kindergarten students to sign an atheist manifesto promising to avoid religious activities in an effort to eradicate religious belief in schoolchildren.
Both pupils and teachers are now required to sign a commitment statement promising they won\x92t browse religious websites or participate in religious forums, and the statement includes the declaration: \x93I will adhere to the correct political direction, advocate science, promote atheism, and oppose theism.\x94
The campaign forbids schools from hiring new teachers who hold religious beliefs, while calling for increased supervision of current teaching staff, including \x93comprehensive inspections of teachers\x92 preparation for lessons in order to root out any and all religious content.\x94
This past summer, the Chinese Communist Party banned a number of Christian summer camps organized for children, insisting that church attendance and religious instruction keep young persons from developing \x93a correct worldview and set of values.\x94
\x93Minors receiving religious education and formation too early in churches would seriously affect the normal implementation of the education system,\x94 declared one notice from officials.
This summer, Catholics have had to cancel summer camps and disguise bible classes to avoid punishment from Chinese authorities.'

b'ROME \x97 The Vatican newspaper L\x92Osservatore Romano published a commentary Tuesday stressing the importance of a recent pastoral letter by the World Council of Churches (WCC) on the \x93peril\x94 of climate change.
\x93Our futures, the well-being of our common home, and the very existence of our species are at risk,\x94 the Vatican warns, citing the WCC document.


The climate change crisis puts to the test \x93our faith in the creator, our love for creation, and our discipleship in the company of Jesus,\x94 states the WCC text, signed by Rev. Olav Fykse Tveit, the group\x92s general secretary.
As other Christian leaders, such as Pope Francis, have done, the WCC laments the failure of the recent COP25 climate conference to reach new international commitments to curb greenhouse gas emissions.
In fact, the text states, we see that \x93nations are failing to keep pace with their commitments, that the dangers and damage of climate change are even worse than we feared, and that the time remaining for us to halt climate damage is less than we hoped.\x94

In the U.N. climate talks, \x93we learned that 200 nations have failed to respond sufficiently to the growing urgency of the climate crisis,\x94 it notes. \x93The outcomes were disappointing, with no increased ambitions to address to scale the adaptation, mitigation, and finance that are needed.\x94
All of this despite the fact \x93the gap is widening between the steps taken by governments in response to the climate emergency, on the one hand, and the compelling scientific evidence and moral obligation to act, on the other,\x94 it states.
The Vatican praises Rev. Tveit for calling all the faithful to \x93creative action\x94 and \x93advocacy\x94 in combating climate change.
As Pope Francis has done, Tveit holds up the example of \x93the strong voices of young people, including in the \x91Fridays for Future\x92 actions, in response to the climate crisis\x94 as well as the input from indigenous peoples, \x93who are on the frontline of climate impacts.\x94
\x93The time for debate and disputation of established scientific facts is long over,\x94 Rev. Tveit declares. \x93The time for action is swiftly passing.\x94
\x93We will all be held to account for our inaction and our disastrous stewardship of this precious and unique planet. The climate emergency is the result of our ecological sins,\x94 he says, calling for conversion in order to face \x93this unprecedented millennial challenge.\x94
\x93Let us join in confronting this global crisis through concerted advocacy for climate change mitigation and adaptation, zero fossil fuel use, and a \x91just transition,\x92\x94 he states.

b'The chairman of the U.S. Bishops\x92 Committee for Religious Liberty praised America\x92s rich tradition of religious freedom while calling for further strides.
\x93The establishment of a culture of religious freedom is always an ongoing task,\x94 said Youngstown Bishop George V. Murry on the occasion of the January 16 celebration of Religious Freedom Day. \x93A culture of religious freedom consists of respect for the dignity of others as they seek to live in accordance with the truth about God. All people can thrive in such a culture.\x94


In his statement underscoring \x93the nation\x92s longstanding commitment to freedom of conscience and the freedom to profess one\x92s own faith,\x94 Bishop Murry expressed gratitude for concrete actions taken by the Trump administration in this regard, \x93such as recent steps to protect faith-based social service providers.\x94
In his own official proclamation of Religious Freedom Day 2020, President Trump reaffirmed his administration\x92s commitment to protecting religious liberty, insisting he would not tolerate \x93the violation of any American\x92s ability to worship freely and openly and to live as his or her faith commands.\x94
\x93Our Founders entrusted the American people with a responsibility to protect religious liberty so that our Nation may stand as a bright beacon for the rest of the world,\x94 the president said. \x93Today, we remain committed to that sacred endeavor and strive to support those around the world who still struggle under oppressive regimes that impose restrictions on freedom of religion.\x94

In his statement, Bishop Murry noted that religious freedom requires further protection.
\x93While the free exercise of religion has long been enshrined in our country\x92s laws, religious minorities have often experienced encroachments on their ability to practice their faith freely,\x94 he noted. \x93Even today, many Jewish, Muslim, Christian, and other communities, all in different ways, face challenges to their religious freedom.\x94
\x93A culture of freedom means that all people of faith and all religious groups are able to freely worship and participate in the life of our society, without fear of intimidation or coercion,\x94 Murry said.
The bishop ended his statement by expressing gratitude for the way religious liberty \x93is cherished in this country,\x94 while calling on his brother Catholics to \x93resolve to build on our inheritance for the good of all.\x94

b'The U.S. Departments of Health and Human Services (HHS) and Homeland Security (DHS) proposed rules Thursday that would implement President Donald Trump\x92s executive order that protects the religious freedom of faith-based organizations.
The proposed rules, announced on Religious Freedom Day, would ensure religious and secular groups are treated equally and rescind Obama-era rules currently in force that place regulatory burdens on faith-based organizations.


HHS Secretary Alex Azar said in a press statement:
President Trump\x92s administration is taking historic action to protect religious social service providers from discrimination in federal regulations. Americans of faith play an essential role in providing healthcare and human services to so many vulnerable people and communities, and President Trump is dedicated to removing every unfair barrier that stands in the way of this important work. Americans from every walk of life deserve to be treated with dignity and respect. Our Constitution and civil rights laws ensure equal treatment and today\x92s action makes clear that the federal government cannot discriminate against people and institutions based on how they live out the dictates of their faith.
Similarly, Acting Secretary of Homeland Security Chad F. Wolf said:
On behalf of DHS, I would like to thank the president for his leadership in helping to reverse the previous administration\x92s requirements discriminating against religious organizations by saddling them with unique regulatory burdens. Our proposed rule recognizes that religious organizations are valuable partners in the federal government\x92s efforts to support the public with needed social services, and that they deserve every chance to compete equally on a level playing field for federal funding and not discriminated against simply because of their religious affiliation.

Religious liberty is the freedom to hold religious beliefs of one\x92s choice and to live out those beliefs. It is an inherent human right for all people of all faiths everywhere. #ReligiousFreedomDay pic.twitter.com/TiHaIJJd1I
\x97 FRC (@FRCdc) January 16, 2020'

b'President Donald Trump blamed his predecessor, former President Barack Obama, on Wednesday for funding the missiles Iran launched against the United States.
\x93The missiles fired last night at us and our allies were paid for with the funds made available by the last administration,\x94 Trump said, referring to the $150 billion returned to the Tehran regime under Obama as part of the Iran nuclear deal.


Iran launched more than a dozen military missiles on Tuesday, targeting American bases in Iraq as a military response to Trump\x92s decision to kill Iranian Quds force commander Qasem Soleimani last week.

Trump said that Iran\x92s hostilities in the Middle East only increased after Obama\x92s \x93foolish\x94 2013 nuclear deal, noting that Iran used the funds to back a campaign of terror around the world.
\x93Iran went on a terror spree, funded by the money from the deal, and created hell in Yemen, Syria, Lebanon, Afghanistan, and Iraq,\x94 he said.
In 2016, then-Secretary of State John Kerry acknowledged\xa0that some of the billions returned to Iran could end up being used for terrorist activities.
\x93I think that some of it will end up in the hands of the IRGC or other entities, some of which are labeled terrorists,\x94 he said in a CNBC interview in January 2016. \x93You know, to some degree, I\x92m not going to sit here and tell you that every component of that can be prevented.\x94
In his speech Wednesday, Trump criticized \x93all nations\x94 for allowing Iran to continue its damaging acts of terrorism around the world since 1979.
\x93Iran has been the leading sponsor of terrorism, and their pursuit of nuclear weapons threatens the civilized world,\x94 Trump said. \x93We will never let that happen.\x94'

b'Rep. Bradley Byrne (R-AL) will introduce a resolution on Thursday to censure House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) for obstructing the impeachment proceedings against President Donald Trump, Breitbart News has learned exclusively.
Byrne, who is vying for the Republican nomination for U.S. Senate this year from his native Alabama, believes the speaker has broken congressional precedence by refusing to send the articles of impeachment to Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell.


\x93Speaker Pelosi\x92s decision to hold the articles of impeachment against President Trump in a pathetic and unconstitutional attempt to extract concessions from the Senate is an unprecedented abuse of power,\x94 Byrne told Breitbart News in an exclusive statement. \x93House Democrats made the misguided decision to rush through the most legally unsound and factually unsupported articles of impeachment in the history of this country, and they can\x92t now insist that the Senate fix their shoddy, incomplete work.\x94

The congressman stated that the House\x92s role in the proceedings was over, and only Pelosi and her allies were left, most notably Reps. Jerry Nadler (D-NY) and Adam Schiff (D-CA), to \x93present\xa0the lackluster case they assembled to the Senate and let the president finally exercise his right to defend himself.\x94
\x93Until then, the leader of this attempt to throw out constitutional norms to remove our president must be held accountable,\x94 Byrne added.
The move comes as Pelosi is holding up the articles in an effort to push the Senate to adopt rules seen as favorable to Democrats for the impeachment trial. In particular, the speaker was rumored to be holding out for an agreement by McConnell to have\xa0former National Security Adviser John Bolton testify. The Senate GOP, for its part, seems to not be buying the ruse, with McConnell announcing on Wednesday his caucus would remain united\xa0in the face of Pelosi\x92s tactics.
It is unclear if Byrne\x92s resolution will receive bipartisan support in the House, especially as a number of high-profile Democrats have already signaled that Pelosi\x92s stalling effort on impeachment is wearing thin.
\x93If we\x92re going to do it, she should send them over,\x94 Sen. Dianne Feinstein (D-CA), the ranking member of the Senate Judiciary Committee, said on Thursday. \x93I don\x92t see what good delay does.\x94'
